Maintain Livestock Register and Poultry feed Register at the Farm and should be countersigned by the Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director on every purchase entry.
Submit Original purchase bills within 30 days of purchase through Area Officer.
Submit Bank passbook copy showing/indicating the payment effected to the party supplying Poultry day old chicks and Poultry Feed.
Submit Livestock Register copy indicating the relevant purchase and countersigned by Area V.O./A.D.
Submit Poultry feed register copy indicating the relevant purchase which should be counter signed by the Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director.
Submit a Certificate stating that (1) the Poultry Farm is not managed by Poultry Integration system and Contract Farming (2) The said premises is not utilized for Poultry Trading activities.

description: This scheme provides a subsidy of Rs. 100 per clay idol to local artisans registered with GHRSSIDC. The scheme aims to revive the traditional clay idol-making industry and ensure its continuity.  The subsidy is available for idols used in religious festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi and Christmas.  Unsold idols are not covered. The maximum number of idols eligible for subsidy is 250 per artisan per year.  The government reimburses the subsidy to GHRSSIDC.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Traditional clay idol makers/artisans registered with GHRSSIDC

procedures.step_description: Artisans must submit an application in the prescribed proforma to GHRSSIDC.
GHRSSIDC will scrutinize the application and verify the production capacity of the artisan.
Artisans shall submit an undertaking that the idols have been produced by them and not imported from outside the state.
GHRSSIDC officials will visit the manufacturing unit to assess capacity and conduct a physical count of idols.
Artisans must maintain records of idols produced and sold, as per the proforma provided by GHRSSIDC.
An Appraisal committee will scrutinize and approve the applications.
Submit sales details along with customer name and address.

title: Scheme for Providing Subsidy for Clay Idol Makers
funding_pattern: The Government shall reimburse the subsidy component under the Scheme to the GHRSSIDC as per the actuals. 50% of the subsidy shall be released by the Government to the Corporation at the time of implementation of the Scheme and the balance upon receipt of utilization certificate.

criteria.description: The idols must be made of clay.
The idols must be a minimum of 1 ft in height.
The idols must be used for religious festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi and Christmas.

The artisans must be registered with GHRSSIDC.

description:
The Sports Authority of Goa requires the below mentioned documents and details in order to consider grant recognition to a Sports Club:
1. Copy of the Certificate under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 issued by Office of the District Registrar of Societies.
2. Certified copy of the Memorandum / Constitution of the Sports Club by the office of the District Registrar.
3. The names of the President, Secretary and Treasurer along with their passport size photograph, residential address (the copy of the address proof), Phone no, email ID.
4. The list of the members of the General Body Committee with minimum 25 members with their Residential Address, Phone No. Email ID etc.
5. The name of the Sports Club, Address, Village, Taluka, District, Constituency, Phone no. and e-mail ID.
6. NOC of the Panchayat / Municipality (original copy signed by the Secretary) stating that they have no objection to register the Club at SAG.
7. NOC from the nearest Sports Club which is registered / recognized by SAG.
8. Whether the Club is affiliated to any State Sports Association in Goa.
9. Report of the activities conducted by the club during the last 3 yrs along with the Photographs, newspaper clipping, etc.
10. Details of the Sports / Game that the Sports Club promotes for the youth in the vicinity of the Club, inclusive of the list of outstanding sportspersons of the Sports Club.
11. Statement of Accounts of the Sports Club audited by the Chartered Accountant.
title: Recognition to Sports Club

description: The Members of Parliament Local Area Development Division is entrusted with the responsibility of implementation of Members of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS). Under the scheme, each MP has the choice to suggest to the District Collector for work to the tune of Rs. 5 Crores per annum to be taken up in his/her constituency. The Rajya Sabha Members of Parliament can recommend works in one or more district in the State from where he/she has been elected. The Nominated Members of the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha may select any one or more Districts from any one State in the Country for implementation of their choice of work under the scheme. The Ministry has issued the guidelines on MPLADS Scheme including implementation and monitoring of the scheme. The Department has initiated all necessary steps to ensure that the scheme is successfully implemented in the field.
title: MPLADS
funding_pattern: Rs. 5 Crores per annum

description: The Rajiv Gandhi Meritorious Students Scholarship Scheme (RGMSSS) is being implemented in the State of Goa since 2009. It awards scholarships to the top three rankers in each Secondary (Std. X) and Higher Secondary School (Std. XII) in the Goa Board Exam.  An amount of Rs. 3000/-, Rs. 2000/-, and Rs. 1000/- is awarded to Secondary School students, and Rs. 4000/-, Rs. 3000/-, and Rs. 2000/- to Higher Secondary School students (of each stream). If there are multiple students with the same rank, each student receives the scholarship corresponding to the shared rank. Information about the scheme is usually released between July and September and posted on the SCERT website.
funding_pattern: scholarship
title: Rajiv Gandhi Students Meritorious Scholarship

description:
The details of financial assistance provided by the Kendriya Sainik Board, New Delhi from the Raksha Mantri's Discretionary Fund to the needy Ex-Serviccmen, widows and their dependents are as under:- 
(a) Penury Grant ofRs. 4000/- pm for life on attaining the age of65 yrs to Non-Pensioners upto Havildar /or equivalent rank in Navy and Air Force and their widow.
(b) Education Grant:
(i) - Boys upto l2th Std Rs. 1000/-pm
(ii) - Girls upto l2th std Rs. 1000/- pm
(iii) Girls up to Graduation Rs. 1000/- pm
(iv) Widows PG Rs. 1000/- pm
(c) Officer Cadet Grant of Rs. 1000/- pm to the wards of Pensioner/Non-Pensioner upto Havildar rank, (applicable to NDA cadets only).
(d) Disabled children grant of Rs. 1000/- pm to Pensioner,Non-Pensioner upto Havildar/ equivalent rank, provided no financial assistance from other source.
(e) House repair grant of Rs. 20000/- to Pensioner/Non-Pensioner upto Havildar/ equivalent rank.
(f) Marriage Grant of Rs. 50,000/- to Pensioner/Non-Pensioner upto Havildar equivalent rank.
(g) Widow Re-marriage Grant of Rs. 16000/- to Pensioner/Non-Pensioner upto Havildar / equivalent rank.
(h) Funeral Grant of Rs. 5000/- to pensioner/non-pensioner upto Havildar/ equivalent rank.
(i) Medical grant of Rs. 30000/- to Non-pensioner upto Havildar / equivalent rank.
(j) Orphan Grant of Rs. 1000/- pm to pensioner/Non-Pensioner upto Havildar equivalent rank i.e
(i) Daughters of Ex-Servicemen till she is married.
(ii) One son of Ex-servicemen upto 2l years of age.
(k) Vocational training grant of Rs. 20000/- (one time) to widows of Pensioner/Non-pensioner upto Havildar / equivalent rank.

description: The state government provides several benefits and concessions to Ex-Servicemen, widows, and their dependents. These include cash grants, cash in lieu of land, and annuities for Gallantry and Distinguished Service Award winners. A special package is provided to dependents of defence personnel killed or disabled in action, with varying amounts based on the circumstances of death or disability. Financial assistance is provided to World War II veterans and their widows, and monetary incentives are available for Goan youth joining the armed forces. War widows also receive monthly assistance. Various exemptions and reservations are provided, including exemptions from registration and stamp duty fees for two properties, house tax exemption, reservation in government jobs, seats in educational institutions, application/examination fees for state civil service recruitment, and priority in government offices for next of kin of martyrs. Additionally, there are reserved quotas for fair price shops and plots/flats from the Goa Housing Board, and free travel concessions for WW-II veterans and widows on KTCL buses within the state.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Gallantry and Distinguished Service Award winners
Next of Kin of deceased defence personnel

description:
The main aims and objectives of the scheme are as under:

(1) To reduce crop losses due to pest/disease infestation.
(2) To promote Integrated Pest Management Technology.
(3) To safeguard the environment and minimize soil, water and air pollution.
(4) To manage weeds in a cost effective
manner.
(5) To arrest spread of pest/diseases.
(6) To increase the productivity of the crops.
(7) To increase the germination percentage
with 100% Seed Treatment.
(8) To have an uniform growth of crop.
(9) To save crop from early pest & diseases infestation.
funding_pattern: Subsidy Pattern\nSeed Treatment Material : 100%\nOther materials       :  75%
title: Scheme for Crop Protection in Agriculture

description:
Modified scheme for Custom Hiring Service in Agriculture.
Objectives:
1. Promote agricultural mechanization.
2. Encourage optimum tillage through custom service facility.
3. Enable completion of agricultural operations in time.
4. Bring mechanization within reach of common farmer.

procedures.step_description: Farmers can hire machinery from Government Departments or Government approved agencies.
50% subsidy on standard hire charges will be provided to farmers at source while booking agriculture machineries on hire from Department of Agriculture.
When hiring from approved agencies, farmers pay full cost and then claim 50% subsidy after completion of work.
Farmers shall apply for subsidy within three months from the date of work completion.

funding_pattern: 50% subsidy on standard hire charges
title: Modified scheme for Custom Hiring Service in Agriculture

description:
Modified scheme for Human Resource Development in Agriculture.
Objective:
1. To empower farmers through technology dissemination and capacity building.
2. To encourage exposure visits to Agri Clinics and Agri Business centers, demonstrations, Kissan melas, seminars, exhibitions.
3. To support education in agriculture and allied sectors through study tours outside Goa for farmers, extension officers, and officials to visit agriculture universities.
4. To enhance the employability of rural youth in the agriculture sector.
Eligibility: Farmers, agriculture officers, individuals, or corporates associated with agriculture or horticulture.
Stipend: Rs. 800 per day for trainees.
Workshops/Exhibitions/Seminars:
Conducted on important agriculture issues and may be sponsored in association with NGOs, voluntary organizations, or farmer clubs.
Financial assistance up to Rs. 2 lakhs (50% of total cost) upon government approval.
Support for Education:
Reservation of seats at Dr. Balasaheb Sawant Konkan Krishi Vidhyapeeth, Dapoli for 17 students.
Objective: Facilitate students from Goa to obtain degrees in agricultural and allied courses.
Pattern of assistance for Graduation (B.Sc(Agri), B.Sc(Hor), B.Tech(Agri)): Rs. 40,000 per year per student (from 01.09.2017).
For students prior to 31.08.2017: Rs. 10,000 per year per student.
Educational support: Rs. 3,000 per month for undergraduate students for a maximum of 4 years.
Pattern of assistance for Post Graduation (M.Sc (Agri/Hort)): Rs. 3,000 per month for students admitted on their own merit in any accredited college/university.
funding_pattern: 50% of total cost up to Rs 2.0 Lakhs, Rs 40,000 per year per student (from 01.09.2017), Rs 10,000 per year per student (prior to 31.08.2017), Rs 3,000 per month for students.
title: Human Resource Development in Agriculture

criteria.description: Farmers should possess Krishi Card of state of Goa.
The farmer for his individual use of tractor should own atleast 10 ha. of area under agriculture duly supported by ownership documents.
Farmer shall be required to furnish the name of the driver for tractor along with copy of his valid driving license.
The farmer for individual use of mini tractor should own 2 ha. and more area under agriculture duly supported by documents of ownership of land.
Farmer shall be required to furnish the name of the driver with the copy of the driving license
The benefit of subsidy for purchase of Power Tiller for individual use requires the farmer to own agriculture land of 1 ha. and more duly supported by ownership documents

Individual farmer owning agriculture land of 3000m2 and more shall be eligible for subsidy to buy a power tiller, provided that such farmer gives an undertaking (self declaration) to hire out their power tiller to other farmers on hire for agriculture operation & needs to register with ZAO / MCO as registered service providers to provide custom service at approved rates and also maintain the register towards the work done
The farmers owning agriculture land of 2000 Sq.metre and more are eligible to avail subsidy for purchase of machinery & equipments.
Manually operated equipments including manually operated sprayers & gator sprayers & the items will be provided to farmers for agriculture purpose having 500 Sq metre or more of agriculture land.
The items used as attachment to main machines shall be provided only 50% subsidy to all category of farmers / groups/ societies who own main machines purchased through subsidy from the department.

Paddy Transplanter of walk behind type will be provided to individual farmer owning at least 4000 m2 of paddy field for self use and to hire out needy farmers & where as riding type transplanter shall be provided only to farmer clubs/ Societies / NGO etc for providing custom service and not to individuals.
paddy combine Harvester shall be provided only to Farmers club / Societies / NGO etc. and not to individuals & will be eligible for only 50% subsidy to all category of farmers/groups/societies.
Mini excavator shall be provided only to Farmers club / Societies / NGO etc. and not to individuals & will be eligible for 75 % subsidy of the actual cost or standard cost whichever is less.

Institutions, Societies, NGO's, Farmers club, etc. shall furnish the registration certificate, resolution of Board, list of board members , copy of Memorandum of Association, mandate form of Bank, letter of authority for paying subsidy to bank, valid driving license of the person who would drive the tractor or mini tractor or paddy combine.
Only registered Farmers Societies, Farmers Clubs or NGO's shall be eligible for availing assistance for Paddy Combine Harvester

description: The average area of cultivation under the Sugarcane crop in the State has remained static over the year so also the average production. It is important to improve the productivity and area under sugarcane crop so that the crop is more remunerative for farmers and also there is adequate supply of cane to the only sugar factory in co-operative sector in the State. This can be achieved by bringing new areas under the crop and by following Modified Sustainable Sugarcane Initiative (MSSI) techniques by the cultivators.

procedures.step_description: The farmers desirous of claiming assistance under the scheme shall apply to Zonal Agricultural Officer online in prescribed form along with scanned copy of certificate issued by Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Kharkhana Ltd., Goa, stating that he is registered grower with them and has brought ‘X’ M2 new area under sugarcane crop during the year by following MSSI guidelines.

Zonal Agricultural Officer shall verify the correctness of the claim/verification on site and determine the admissible amount of the assistance to the farmer as per the expenditure receipts/vouchers produced in support of the claim.
The claim thus received shall be uploaded for the scrutiny and sanction by the District Agriculture Officer, South/North-Goa.

funding_pattern: The farmers will get assistance @ Rs. 10,000/- per ha. towards the cost of land preparation and planting of single bud seedlings. The assistance will be 50% of the cost of expenditure on labour charges or Rs. 10,000/- per ha. whichever is less.
title: Promotion of Modified Sustainable Sugarcane Initiative (MSSI)

description:
Revitalization of neglected Khazan lands back to cultivation by providing seed of local Korgut and other salt resistant paddy varieties.
Distribution of seed at 100% subsidized rate and improving productivity by adopting proper package of practices.
Attract the younger generation back to agriculture specially under Khazan land ecosystem.
Make available the quality seed material for improving the productivity.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Farmers cultivating Khazan rice fields in Goa and having Krishi Card issued by the Directorate of Agriculture.
Lease holders of Khazan rice fields in the State.

procedures.step_description: The Directorate of Agriculture will procure seed of Korgut and other salt tolerant varieties from the registered seed growers under the departmental seed multiplication programme.

Three approved agencies in co-operative sectors i.e. M/s Goa Bagayatdar Sahakari Kharedi Vikri Saunstha Maryadit, Ponda; M/s Goa Krishi Bazar Marketing and Processing Co-operative Society, Mapusa and M/s Pernem Taluka Farmers Society, Pernem will also procure quality seed from Seed Corporations/Registered seed growers etc.
As special case, seed of new salt resistant varieties will be procured from reputed private seed producers and Research Institutes like ICAR, Agriculture Universities etc.

All such seeds will be distributed at pre-fixed price of Rs. 30 per kilo by the above three agencies and Departmental sub offices by providing 100% subsidy at source basis as per the existing arrangements.
Farmers will be allowed subsidy for maximum 100 kgs per farmer of salt tolerant paddy seed for cultivation.
The farmers cultivating the Khazan land will be identified by the respective Zonal Agriculture Officer and given the recommendation slip to collect the seed from the concerned Society.
The subsidy provided at source shall be reimbursed directly to the concerned Society by the Department of Agriculture under this scheme on submission of bills and statement.

100% inspection of the cases shall be carried out by the Zonal Agricultural Officers before issue of administrative approval/submission of claim for settlement and certificate to that effect shall be endorsed in the claim.
25% of the cases shall be randomly inspected by the District Agricultural Officers before release of subsidy.
The District Agricultural Office shall draw and disburse the subsidy through the Directorate of Accounts by ECS mode.

funding_pattern: 100% subsidy at source basis
title: Revitalization of Khazan lands by seed distribution of salt resistant paddy varieties and subsidized rates

description: One time assistance to farmers for removal of weeds/ shrubs/ bushes, aquatic weeds by hiring power driven machinery/ equipments/ manually.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Individual farmers involved in cultivation of various types of agricultural horticultural Crops.
Farmer registered under Krishi card Programme of the Directorate of Agriculture.

procedures.step_description: Interested farmer shall apply to the Zonal Agricultural officer (Z.A.o.) in whose jurisdiction the plot/field is located.
He/she shall mention details of area to be cleared and type of machinery intended to be used.
The concerned Z.A.o. will inspect/field and accord administrative approval if the proposal is found feasible.

Upon receipt of administrative approval, the farmer shall get the clearing work executed by hiring machinery/equipment from any private/public sector agency, including labour and intimate the Z.A.o. regarding completion of the work and submit relevant payment vouchers/ invoices.
The cleared area should be used exclusively for cultivation of agricultural/ horticultural crop.
The subsidy will be released only after verification and certification by Z.A.o. regarding satisfactory plantation of the Agricultural/Horticultural crop in the cleaned/cleared area.

The farmer shall submit an affidavit on stamp paper of value as specified from time to time stating that he/she would exclusively utilize the concerned field/plot to cultivate agricultural/ horticultural crop and continue to do so for six years or more.

funding_pattern: 50% of the expenditure incurred towards hire charges of machinery/ equipment including labour wages for removal of weeds/shrubs/bushes etc will be provided limited to Rs.15,000 per hectare or 50% of the actual expenditure whichever is less
title: One time assistance to farmers for removal of weeds/ shrubs/ bushes, acquatic weeds by hiring power driven machinery equipments/manually

description: To provide financial boost to ST farmers for taking up agriculture for their economic upliftment and to encourage youths from the ST communities for self employment in agriculture  and to build confidence among the ST farmers against the price inflation of the inputs and follow recommended package of practices.

procedures.step_description: The scheme shall be implemented & monitored by Plant Protection Section under control of Dy. Director of Agriculture (PP).
The applicant farmer shall purchase the required inputs like seed, planting material, fertilizer & pesticide.
Farmer shall submit the claims to the Zonal Agriculture Officer with all the documents listed for attachment alongwith application.
The Zonal Agriculture Officer shall verify the case and recommend the subsidy as per the pattern of assistance to the Directorate.
The cases shall scrutinized by plant Protection Section at Directorate of Agriculture, and eligible cases shall be sanctioned for subsidy.
The subsidy shall be drawn and disbursed by Zonal Agriculture Officer, and paid by ECS.

description: Micro Irrigation PDMC under PMKSY Scheme will be implemented by the Department of Agriculture to enhance water use efficiency by promoting appropriate technological interventions like drip & sprinkler technologies, efficient water application & distribution system.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Incorporated Companies with agriculture development as their mandate

procedures.step_description: The cultivators interested shall submit his application in the prescribed format along with Krishi Card copy/Farmers Abstract copy.
Prior administrative approval of Directorate of Agriculture (ZAO/DAO/ D.Agri) should be obtained for Irrigation / Micro Irrigation schemes.

Farmers shall carry out the work as per the advice of the Zonal Agricultural Officer and report the completion of the work along with photograph, bills and receipt. Farmers should display a board as given in Annexure III.

The project/site will be inspected by Zonal Agricultural Officer or his representative and processed for release of subsidy as per the pattern of assistance, and submitted to District Agricultural Officer (DAO).

The District Agricultural Office shall examine the claim, issue expenditure sanction for subsidy and shall draw and disburse the subsidy through concerned office of the Directorate of Accounts by ECS mode. Sanction Orders for subsidy above Rs. 3.00 lakhs shall be issued under the signature of the Director of Agriculture.

title: Micro Irrigation PDMC under PMKSY Scheme
funding_pattern: 55% of the total cost of installation for small and marginal farmers and 45% for other farmers.

criteria.description: New system installed by approved manufacturer which have not availed any subsidy in past under any of the Government Schemes.
Combined area for sprinkler and drip irrigation should not exceed 5.0 hectare per beneficiary.
Assistance for both sprinkler and drip irrigation will not be available for a crop on the same plot/field being cultivated by the farmer.
Assistance for sprinkler irrigation will be limited to only those crops where drip irrigation is uneconomical.

documents: Survey plan showing the sketch of layout of micro irrigation system
Letter of Authority of applicant to pay subsidy directly to his/her loan account
One set of GAR-32 duly signed
Receipts of digging of kenches and other expenditure incurred
Quotations from irrigation/ micro irrigation dealers/company registered with the Directorate of Agriculture

description: The Goa Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan Scheme, launched in 2018-19 by the Department of School Education under the Ministry of Human Resource Development, integrates three major schemes: Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA), Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA), and Teacher Education (TE).  Implemented through a Single State Implementation Society (SIS), it aims to provide quality education and enhance learning outcomes by bridging social and gender gaps, ensuring equity and inclusion, and promoting vocationalization.  Key interventions include infrastructure development, teacher training, digital initiatives, and RTE entitlements.  The scheme prioritizes Educationally Backward Blocks (EBBs), LWEs, Special Focus Districts (SFDs), border areas, and aspirational districts.  Focus is placed on improving quality through teachers and technology, with flexibility given to states for planning and prioritizing interventions.

sponsors.sponsor_type: Department of School Education, Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India

funding_pattern: 60:40 split between Centre and States
title: Goa Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan Scheme

description: The Government of Goa is pleased to approve the revised scheme and pattern of financial assistance to the Urban Cooperative Credit Societies and Primary Agricultural Credit Cooperative Societies having branches/extension counters in the State for computerization of records.

description:
Evaluate new varieties with improved yield and/or quality characters in farmer’s fields.
Popularize improved varieties of food grain crops which are superior to existing varieties.
Identify varieties suitable for region specific problems such as pest/disease incidence etc.
Popularize labor and time saving cultivation techniques such as mechanized transplanting of paddy to increase net returns.
Propagate new cultivation techniques e.g. System of Rice Intensification (SRI) method and Aerobic cultivation in paddy etc., to increase productivity.

procedures.step_description: The programme will be monitored by Agronomy section under the control of Dy. Director of Agriculture.
The applicant will apply with the requisite documents to the concerned Zonal Agriculture Officer (Z.A.O.) in case of “Incentive for mechanised paddy transplanting”.
ZAO shall verify documents & costs and accord administrative approval for purchase and endorse a copy to Head Office.

After purchase, the applicant shall furnish original copies of receipts/purchase invoice or, in case of loan availed from bank, duplicate copy duly attested by Branch Manager to the Zonal Agricultural Officer.
The Z.A.O. shall inspect the items and also verify that mat nursery has been raised and give his recommendation and forward the claim to Head Office for sanction.
The Dy. Director of Agriculture (Agron) will scrutinize the documents and recommend release of subsidy if in order.
In case of demonstration under SRI and minikits, willing farmers shall be identified and covered under the schemes by Zonal Agriculture Officers.

The Zonal Agriculture Officer concerned will prepare an Utilization Certificate in the standard format along with list of beneficiaries with details of inputs supplied and forward the same to the Directorate of Agriculture for record and monitoring.

description:
A member of the Fund who has been working as a building worker for not less than one year after the commencement of these rules shall on completion of sixty years of age be eligible for pension. The pension will become payable from the first day of the succeeding month to the month in which he completes sixty years of age.
Procedure for payment of pension:
(1) An application for pension shall be submitted in Form No. XX.XV to the Secretary of the Board or the officer authorized by him for the purpose.
(2) If in the opinion of the Secretary of the Board or the officer authorized by him, the applicant is eligible for pension, he shall sanction pension and send the pension sanctioning order to the applicant. Provided that no application shall be rejected unless the applicant has been given an opportunity of being heard.
(3) If it is found that the applicant is not eligible for pension, the application shall be rejected, and the applicant informed accordingly.
(4) The applicant may file an appeal before the Board against the decision taken under sub-rule (3) within sixty days from the date of the receipt of the order. Provided that the Board may for sufficient reason in writing condone the delay upto one year in filing the appeal.
(5) The amount of pension shall be one hundred and fifty rupees per mensem. An increase of ten rupees shall be given for every completed year of service beyond five years. The Board may, with the previous approval of the Government revise the pension.
(6) The pension sanctioning authority shall maintain a register in Form No. XXXVI.

procedures.step_description: An application for pension shall be submitted in Form No. XX.XV to the Secretary of the Board or the officer authorized by him for the purpose.

description: The scheme provides financial assistance to researchers and students in Goa for research projects in science and technology.  It supports individual researchers, those from reputable institutes, and student groups from polytechnics, engineering, and science colleges, including Goa University.  The grant covers equipment, travel, and other project-related expenses.  A Project Review Committee evaluates proposals, and grants are awarded up to Rs. 2,50,000/- per year for researchers and students, with a maximum project duration of 3 years for researchers.  Higher grant amounts may be considered in specific cases with government approval.

procedures.step_description: Submit a project proposal.
Project proposal reviewed by DSTE and relevant authorities/institutions.

Recommendations presented to a committee comprising Principal Secretary (Science & Technology), Director of Department of Science and Technology, Member Secretary of GSCST, and Environmental Engineer/Representative of GSPCB.
Grants disbursed in two installments: 60% upon proposal approval and 40% upon expenditure statement submission.

funding_pattern: 50% reimbursement up to Rs. 20,000/-

description: This scheme envisages the preservation of the rich experiences of the veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely to the development of Tiatr. Their experiences form a part and parcel of the history of Tiatr.\nThe scheme is formulated in order to preserve the oral history of tiatr for future generations.

procedures.step_description: The concerned who wants to avail the benefit of this scheme shall submit a self-attested copy of Aadhar Card along with the application.

funding_pattern: Onetime remuneration as fixed by the TAG
title: Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr

criteria.description: The veteran artistes who will be considered in the scheme for visual recording of their experiences are: script writers, directors, actors, singers, musicians, backstage artistes such as those involved in stage setting, light effects, background music, costumes, make-up, etc. and those involved in organizing tiatrs. The artiste concerned should have made at least 20 years contribution to the Konkani stage, i.e. a writer/director must script at least 15 tiatrs. If the artiste is other than writer/director, then he/she should have participated at least in 20 tiatrs.
At least five artistes will be considered for documentation in a financial year.

description: The maintenance, repairs, and construction of new school buildings for Government Primary, Middle, Secondary and Higher Secondary Schools is carried out under this scheme. The estimate for construction of new school building is prepared by the Public Works Department as per the approved drawing from Chief Architect, Public Works Department. The Director of Education issues sanction order to P.W.D for construction on obtaining administrative approval and expenditure sanction. Maintenance, repairs, construction of toilet blocks and compound walls are carried out by the P.W.D. and GSIDC. Minor repairs works of the schools up to a ceiling of Rs.50,000/- per work is also carried out by the Village/Urban Education Committees. The civil works of Government Primary and Middle Schools are also attended to by Goa Sarva Shikhsa Abhiyan. The Hon’ble Chief Minister of Goa in his Budget Speech for the year 2009-10 has announced that 100 new school buildings will be constructed by demolishing the old school buildings, which are in dilapidated condition. GSIDC shall in the year 2010-11 begin the construction of 100 Government schools and the up gradation of another 100 schools. The Finance Department has proposed to avail loan from NABARD for construction of the school buildings.The work of the construction of the Directorate of Education at Porvorim is nearly completion.
funding_pattern: The outlay Proposed under the above component of the scheme for the year 2011-12 is Rs. 1773.45 Lakhs.
title: School Infrastructure Development

description: 75% subsidy, Rs. 67500/-per ha. Min. area 0.2 and Max.4.0 ha.(Min nos. 250 banana suckers, 320 tissue culture suckers and 4500 pineapple plants
title: Assistance for cultivation of Banana, Pineapple & Papaya
funding_pattern: CENTRAL & STATE

description:
The Women Sports Festival was introduced first in 1975. The year was being celebrated as International year for Women, as a part of the celebration the Government of India decided to bringing all the Sports Women of the Country together by organizing a Women Sports Festival.
The response was tremendous that the Government of India decided of having it as an annual event and till date it is being held by the Sports Authority of India.
The Women in Goa have an opportunity to show their talent at: Taluka Level, District Level, State Level, National Level.
At the National Level the twelve sports discipline are divided into four groups having three sports discipline in each group. Each group is held at different venues, in different States. The Sports Authority of Goa, deputes the Women teams for the National Level Sports Festival, in all the four groups. All the expenditure to depute the team for the National is borne by the Sports Authority of Goa. This includes coaching camp allowances, the full kit, TA/DA, train fare, refreshment allowances and miscellaneous expenditure.
At the State Level 11 Sports discipline are held out of twelve, which the Sports Authority of India has included at the national Level, Women Sports Festival, Women from all eleven talukas come together to take part at the State Level, it is held for two days, the first four winners at the District level in individual events and first two places in team events come for the State Level. The Sports Authority of Goa conduct the District Level Women Sports Festival. It is conducted in North and South Goa the first six winners at the Taluka Level in the individual and the first two winners in the team events comes for the District Level. The Sports Authority of Goa, use a grant of Rs.40,000/- to all the 11 talukas to conduct the Taluka Level Women Sports Festival. There are committees formed in all the 11 Talukas, and the important personalities in the Taluka are involved like the Dy. Collector, Malatdars, S.D.P.O, B.D.O, Police Inspectors, Principals, Headmasters, Govt. Officers, Sarpanches, etc. Every year this committee’s organize the Taluka Level Women Sports Festival, the merit certificates are given by the Sports Authority of Goa.
funding_pattern: The Sports Authority of Goa bears all expenses for the National Level Sports Festival, including coaching camp allowances, kit, TA/DA, train fare, and other miscellaneous expenditures. A grant of Rs.40,000 is provided to each of the 11 talukas for conducting the Taluka Level Women Sports Festival.
title: Women’s Festival & Kerkar Awards

criteria.description: No age bar.

description: The scheme entails providing financial assistance to sportspersons.
title: SCHEME FOR PRESENTATION OF BAKSHI ANAND JIVABADADA KERKAR AWARD
funding_pattern: Not specified
department_name: Department of Sports and Youth Affairs

description: Financial assistance scheme for sportspersons in indigent circumstances. The financial assistance will be in the form of pensions from Rs. 3,000/- to Rs. 5,000/- for a specified period. Such pensions may also be sanctioned for life.  If the income of the applicant is likely to exceed Rs. 7,000/- per month then pension can be sanctioned only for five years. The Director of Sports & Youth Affairs/Executive Director will be the final authority to consider the applications for sanctioning financial assistance.
funding_pattern: Rs. 3,000/- to Rs. 5,000/- per month for a specified period or for life.
title: Financial Assistance Scheme for Sportspersons

criteria.description: Applicant must be born or domiciled in Goa.
Applicant's income from all sources, including their spouse, must be less than Rs. 7,000/- per month.

documents: Residence certificate from the Mamlatdar/Competent Authority
Birth certificate from the Registrar of Births & Deaths/Church or School
Particulars of income and family duly certified by the Mamlatdar or the locality
Certificates of achievements in the field of games and sports duly certified by the Sports & Youth Affairs
Marriage certificate in case of widows

description: The scheme intends to provide sports equipment and create gymnasiums within the jurisdiction of local bodies in Goa. This initiative aims to promote a healthy lifestyle and encourage participation in sports among students. Key features include financial aid for educational institutions for sports equipment, special casual leave for teachers attending disability-related events, and preference in transfer postings for teachers of winning school teams.
funding_pattern: Financial aid of Rs. 10,000 for educational institutions for sports equipment and kits worth Rs.40,000 will be provided.
title: Scheme for Setting up of Gymnasiums

description: The State Youth Award is presented to young people (aged 15-35) in Goa, India, to encourage and recognize their contributions in fields such as national development, social service, and sports.  The award includes a trophy, certificate, and Rs. 20,000. It aims to foster a sense of responsibility within the youth community and acknowledge the significant work they do for the betterment of the state.  Nominations can come from various sources, including voluntary youth organizations, educational institutions, and government bodies.  The selection process involves state-level committees that scrutinize the nominations based on criteria such as the impact of the service rendered, the individual's reputation, and their demonstrated commitment to their chosen field.
title: State Youth Award
funding_pattern: Rs. 20000/- per awardee

criteria.description: Should be between 15-35 years of age on the cutoff date.
Should have rendered service in the relevant field during the last three years prior to the year of the award.
Should have demonstrably outstanding work in different fields.
The impact of the services rendered should be clearly evident.
Should not have received this award previously.

description: Financial assistance for educational institutions.
title: Financial Assistance for Educational Institutions' Sports Facilities
funding_pattern: 5% to 25% of project acquisition cost

description: Scheme for implementation of the Goa State Youth Policy 2015 through the release of Grant in aid and the organization of various Programmes for the benefit of the youth.
title: Scheme for Implementation of the Goa State Youth Policy 2015

The Goa Khadi and Village Industries Board is a Statutory Organisation constituted under GDDKVIB Act of 1965. Achievements for the year 2019-20 under various schemes and programmes are as follows:

* **Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP):** A credit linked subsidy programme where tiny units are provided a subsidy of 15% to 25% of the project cost for credit drawn through Public sector Banks. Projects up to Rs 25 lakhs for manufacturing and up to Rs 10 lakhs for service sectors are considered. 
* **Scheme for Training in Village Industries Sector:** Approved by the Government of Goa on 7/1/2020.
* **Scheme for promotion of Beekeeping Industry:** Subsidises Bee hives & equipments up to 90% of the cost for trained general category candidates and up to 95% for trained SC/ST candidates. Notified on 7/1/2020 with a yearly provision of Rs 75 lakhs.
title: Goa Khadi and Village Industries Board Schemes 2019-20

description: This scheme is introduced to provide financial assistance in the form of loan to the members of Scheduled Tribes for the purpose of repair, renovation/reconstruction of house.

procedures.step_description: The applicants need to fill up the prescribed loan application form complete in all respect along with 02 (Two) passport size photographs.

The prescribed loan application form shall only be accepted with all the required documents under the Scheme after proper scrutiny. Thereafter the list of eligible applicants will be prepared and physical verification / inspection will be carried out by the officer of the Corporation. The application form along with documents and inspection report will be placed before the sanctioning authority as specified below for appraisal and approval.
The loan amount shall be advanced in two installments after submission of required documents complete in all respect.

title: ASHRAYA ADHAR SCHEME
funding_pattern: Up to Rs. 5,00,000/- shall be advanced as financial assistance in the form of loan @ 2% per annum.

criteria.description: Any person belonging to Scheduled Tribe Community and having his house (which shall also include mundcarial house) either owned individually or jointly will be eligible for financial assistance under this scheme. In case the house is owned jointly and there are different units of the family in the same house residing separately, each such unit will be eligible for financial support under this scheme. EXPLANATION: Family means Husband, Wife, and Unmarried Children. The Father, Mother and unmarried brothers and sisters fully dependent and staying with the applicant shall also form part of the “family”.

The age of the applicant should not be more than 55 years as on the date of loan application. However, the age of the applicant is relaxed up to 58 years in case the applicant is an employee of State/ Central Government/ Government Corporation/ Board or aided Institute.

documents: Age proof of applicant (Birth Certificate / School Leaving Certificate / Driving License)
Self Affidavit on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized
The copy of latest house tax receipt
N.O.C from Co-owner (if any) on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized

Income Proof of the applicant i.e. salary certificate/ Last 03 months Pay slips along with Form 16 or last 06 months Bank Statement. Incase applicant is self employed then Last 3 years I.T.R. along with last 06 months bank statement or income declaration cum affidavit on 50/- stamp paper duly notarized to be produced

02(Two) sureties with one passport photo of each surety, latest salary certificate or last three (03) months payslips along with last (06) months bank statement or Form 16 , affidavit of surety on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized and ID proof of surety. In case the applicant produces one surety working in the Government Department/ Corporation/ Board/Aided Institute then 2nd Surety not required. In case of applicant is the employee of State/ Central Government/ Government Corporation/ Board or aided Institute no surety is required
Estimated Cost of Repair/Renovation/Reconstruction of house (as per format)
Photos of the house to be repaired/renovated/reconstructed
Two passport size photos of applicant

description: The Department of Fisheries, Goa offers various financial assistance schemes to support the fisheries sector. These schemes cover a wide range of activities including setting up farming units, purchasing equipment, constructing markets, and providing relief during natural calamities.  Specific schemes include assistance for crab farming, brackish water and freshwater aquaculture, mussel and oyster farming, ornamental fish units, purchase of life jackets and lifebuoys, fuel subsidies, and construction of fish markets.
funding_pattern: Financial Assistance, Subsidy
title: Schemes available with the Department of Fisheries, Goa

description: The scheme is being implemented for active fishermen by providing insurance cover to the fishermen who are prone to accidents at sea due to rough weather and other natural calamities. The scheme is also offering life insurance cover for death of fishermen/crew due to any reason. This scheme shall be implemented as per pattern/rules approved by the Government of India/LIC from time to time. The annual premium payable is Rs. 330/- per annum per member to cover the eligible person in the scheme.

Applicant shall be residence of Goa for more than 15 years.

The Economic Development Corporation of Goa (EDC) Ltd. is the implementing agency.

Beneficiaries may be required to undergo Entrepreneurship Development Programme (EDP).

The applicant must be unemployed.

description: The Kamdhenu Scheme (Sudharit) has been amended. The amendment pertains to Clause 15 of the scheme and specifies that animals purchased under the scheme should be insured for a minimum period of 3.5 years. The beneficiary is responsible for insuring the animals upon purchase, and the government is not liable for the animal's death. The financing institution is responsible for the insurance tie-up, and the premium, including transit insurance, is initially borne by the beneficiary/institution. The department will reimburse the premium up to Rs. 14,455/- per animal to the financing institution along with the subsidy amount, upon receiving all required documents.
funding_pattern: subsidy
title: Kamdhenu Scheme (Sudharit)
department_name: Department of Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services

title: Financial assistances to tiny Artisans
funding_pattern: Small loans

description: This scheme is basically aimed at meeting the expenditure on Administration such as salaries, travel expenses, office expenses, Rent Rates and Taxes, Advertisement and Publicity and other contingent expenditure. The Government has decided to strengthen its Department in order to cope up with growing IT trend in Government sector. At present this Department is having staff strength of 61 employees. The technical staff has been given the job of monitoring, implementation, development of various ongoing as well as planned projects initiated by Department for the various Government offices. The staff strength of the Department also include the 30 staff recruited on contract basis (both Technical and Administrative) i.e. -Dy. Director (IT) (1 No), Software Engineers (10 Nos), Technical Assistants (13 Nos), Business Development Manager (1 No), Lower Division Clerks (4 Nos) and Peon (1 No). The Department is also in the process of creation of IT cadre under which, IT professionals will be placed in various Departments across the State of Goa to address the immediate requirement of IT. The department also proposes enhancement of Administrative manpower. In order to meet all this requirement and smooth functioning of the Department, a provision of Rs. 393.00 lakhs is made in the financial year 2014-15.
title: Direction & Administration

description: Under this scheme the financial support will be advanced up to a maximum Rs. 10 lakh to any individual person belonging to Scheduled Tribes Community to undertake any self employment activities that will be approved by the Corporation time to time. The Loan /Financial assistance will also be made available to the extent of Rs. 15 lakhs to the Association / Societies / Partnership / Self help groups (SHG) / Companies formed exclusively by the member of Schedule Tribes Community. The beneficiary is required to contribute 10% margin money towards the cost of project. The loan / financial assistance shall bear the rate of interest at 4% per annum (Reducing balance method). If the loan /financial assistance is overdue 2% penal interest shall be charged on the amount of overdue installments and the entire loan along with the interest shall be recovered as land revenue arrears. The repayment period shall be decided by the Board of Directors from time to time and depending upon the nature of business. The applicant will have to provide two guarantor / Surety who is having a sound financial status or income tax payee or property owner. One Guarantor should necessarily be a Government Servant. The applications received shall be scrutinized by the Sub-Committee duly constituted by the Corporation and recommend the aforesaid applications for approval of the Board of Directors. The beneficiary shall mortgage the business activity to the Corporation till the repayment of full and final dues of settlement as per the agreement in the prescribed form. The life of the beneficiary and the business activity shall be insured from fire, theft, cyclone and other natural calamities with the agency identified by the Corporation and the said policy shall be endorsed in the name of Corporation. In the event of any calamity the compensation received from Insurance Company shall be adjusted against the loan outstanding in the Corporation.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Individual person belonging to Scheduled Tribes Community
Association / Societies / Partnership / Self help groups (SHG) / Companies formed exclusively by the member of Schedule Tribes Community

procedures.step_description: Scrutiny of applications by the Sub-Committee.
Recommendation of applications for approval of the Board of Directors.

Further, Father, Mother and unmarried brother and sister below the age of 18 years fully dependent and staying with the applicant shall also form as family.
The age of the applicant should not be more than 55 years.

This scheme aims to help those facing difficulties in accessing financial assistance or borrowing from money lenders at high interest rates. The loan carries an interest rate of 2% per annum, payable in a maximum of 10 installments. Overdue loans will incur a 1% penal interest on the outstanding amount.

description:
The scheme of Family Counselling Centre was introduced by CSWB in 1983. The Family Counselling Centres provide counselling, referral and rehabilitative services to women and children who are victims of atrocities, family maladjustments and social ostracism and also provide crisis intervention and trauma counselling in case of natural disasters. The Centres also create awareness and mobilize public opinion on social issues affecting status of women. The FCCs work in close collaboration with the local administration, police, courts, free legal aid cells, medical and psychiatric institutions, vocational training centres, short stay homes etc.
OBJECTIVES
i)To provide professional services like crisis intervention, independent inquiry in dowry death cases and counselling in family maladjustment.
ii)To make efforts for reconciliation in the cases of separation and out of the court settlement in marital cases.
iii)To provide referral services like short stay homes, free legal aids, police assistance etc.
iv) To make the counselling services available in short stay homes, remand homes, orphanages, drug de-addiction centres, Old age homes, shelter homes, prisons, schools for gifted children etc.
v)To educate and mobilize public opinion against social problems.
vi)To educate and impart information regarding social welfare activities aided & undertaken by various governmental and non-governmental agencies for better coordination and services to the people.
vii) To arrange for suitable rehabilitation services for the victims and their dependents.viii) To provide crisis intervention services to deal with any problem of the individual within the family work place or in the community.
funding_pattern: 90% contribution by CSWB and 10% matching contribution by VO
title: SCHEME OF FAMILY COUNSELLING CENTRE

description: The Goatery Scheme provides financial assistance for purchasing and rearing indigenous goat breeds suitable to Goa's climate. It aims to increase meat production, create jobs, encourage scientific goat farming, and upgrade local goat stock.  The scheme offers a 75% subsidy on the cost of 10 does and one buck, along with transportation incentives.  A 75% subsidy is also available for shed construction.  Additional financial support is provided for feed costs for one year, with the condition that feed is purchased from certified dealers with receipts submitted quarterly.
funding_pattern: 75% subsidy on the cost of goats (10 does and 1 buck), transportation, shed construction, and feed for one year.
title: Goatery Scheme

criteria.description: Any farmer residing for minimum 5 years in the state.
Should have undergone training in Goat Management.
Should have goat shed on height of approx. 1.5 mts. from ground admeasuring minimum 30 sq mts. with flooring of bamboo/matti and roof of tiles/sheets/straw.

documents: Certificate of training in Goat Management
Documents indicating the ownership of land in Form No.I & XIV or copy of lease deed for 3 years or NOC from the Land Owner for 3 years in case of Tenants for the purpose of Goat farming
Passport size photograph of the applicant
Bond and Affidavit (Annexure I & II of the Scheme)

description: The Goa Small Animal Rescue Management Scheme, 2014, aims to reduce the suffering of the stray dog population in Goa. The scheme focuses on sterilizing and vaccinating stray dogs against rabies, thereby controlling their population and protecting both animals and humans from the disease.  The scheme offers financial assistance for various components, including vehicle purchase, salaries for drivers and veterinary surgeons, sterilization costs, construction of shelters and cages, feeding, vaccination, and other related expenses.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: International Animal Organizations authorized by the Animal Welfare Board of India

procedures.step_description: Animal Welfare Organizations (AWOs) with MoUs with Local Bodies apply for grants through the local bodies to the Director of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services.
Local bodies (Corporation, Municipality, Panchayat) can also apply individually.
Local Body verifies application and recommends it to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services.
For infrastructure grants, land ownership or lease documents and NOC from Statutory authorities are required.
Upon approval, grants are disbursed electronically to the local body.
Local body deposits grants in a separate account and disburses to AWO as needed.
Commissioner/Chief Officer/Secretary of the local body verifies and certifies bills and submits an audited report with Utilization Certificates.

funding_pattern: The scheme provides grants up to 90% for vehicle costs, 100% for driver/animal catcher salary, 100% for surgery, animal feed, medication, and veterinary surgeon salary, 100% for shelter and cages, 100% for feeding (3 days pre- and post-surgery), 100% for sterilization costs, and other grants for survey, disposal, microchips, publicity etc.
title: The Goa Small Animal Rescue Management Scheme 2014

criteria.description: The Animal Welfare Organizations should necessarily be registered in Goa and working in Goa for last 3 years.
Those Organizations who have applied for grants from the Animal welfare Board of India for the same components shall not be eligible for the same grants under this Scheme.
Have signed Memorandum of Understanding with the Animal Welfare Organizations with the Local Bodies.

department_name: Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description: The Goa Stray Cattle Management Scheme, 2013 (Modified) aims to address the stray cattle menace in Goa by making the scheme open to all the Municipalities, Panchayats, AWOs, Goshalas and Civic & Consumer Forums (CCF). The scheme involves impounding stray cattle, transporting them to cattle pounds, providing care for the animals, and facilitating their release to owners upon payment of fines.  The scheme also encourages citizen involvement by reporting the presence of stray cattle to designated authorities.

procedures.step_description: AWOs, Goshalas, and CCFs apply for grants through local bodies.
Local bodies can also apply individually.
Applications are routed through the local body and recommended to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services.
Grants are disbursed to the local body through Electronic Clearing System.
Local bodies deposit grants in a separate account and disburse them to AWOs, Goshalas, and CCFs as needed.
Bills are verified and certified by the Commissioner/Chief Officer/Secretary of the local body.
Stray cattle are impounded and transported to cattle pounds.
Cattle are provided with feed, water, shelter, and medical care.
Owners can claim impounded cattle by proving ownership and paying fines.
Unclaimed cattle may be auctioned to farmers for breeding/draught purposes.

title: The Goa Stray Cattle Management Scheme, 2013 (Modified)
funding_pattern: The scheme offers financial assistance for various components, including vehicle purchase (up to 90% grant), driver salary, shed construction, cattle feeding, veterinary surgeon salary, attendant salaries, rumenotomy costs, stray cattle surveys, burial of dead animals, and microchipping/notching.
department_name: Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description: Provides credit facilities to farmers at a subsidized interest rate to accelerate investment in agriculture and allied sectors.

procedures.step_description: Farmers under Agriculture and Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services directly approach banks with required documentation. Banks sanction loans as per usual norms.
For Fisheries loans, applicants apply through the Directorate of Fisheries, which scrutinizes applications and forwards them to banks within 15 days.
Interest subsidy is released quarterly. Bank branches send claims to the Director of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, or Fisheries, as appropriate.

valid_upto: Initially for a period of three years and will be reviewed for continuation on completion of three years.
funding_pattern: Government bears the interest over and above 4% charged by the institutions as interest subsidy to the farmer.
title: Interest Subsidy on Loans for Agriculture and Allied Activities
introduced_on: Not specified, mentioned as \"with immediate effect\"

criteria.description: Kisan Credit Card holders or non-holders.
Maximum loan amount of Rs. 5.00 lakhs either as one or more loans taken for one or more purposes.

description: The Varah Palan Scheme provides financial assistance for the purchase and rearing of exotic/crossbred pigs to augment pork production and provide supplementary income to farmers. The scheme offers subsidies for purchasing piglets or adult pigs (up to 20 females and 2 males), shed construction, and other equipment, with varying subsidy rates depending on the category and weight of the pigs.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Farmer residing for at least 5 years in Goa

procedures.step_description: Submit application to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services through respective Veterinary Officer.
Obtain NOC from Village Panchayat.
Set up the piggery unit (self-financed or through loan).
Purchase piglets from Government Piggery Farm or registered farms with NOC.
Set up the unit within 6 months of sanction.
Submit utilization certificate and receipts to receive subsidy.
Execute agreement bond for a minimum 5-year operation.
Vaccinate pigs regularly.

funding_pattern: Subsidy of 62.5% for male piglets (max Rs. 9,000 each), 74% for female piglets (max Rs. 8,000 each), up to Rs. 2,000 per pig for shed construction, 75% for Gobar gas unit (max Rs. 37,500), and 75% for other equipment (max Rs. 26,100).
title: Varah Palan Scheme
documents: Certificate of training in Piggery Management

criteria.description: Any farmer residing for minimum 05 years in the state.
Should have undergone training in Piggery Management
The scheme is applicable for any individual in the State however, area of operation shall be only Panchayat.

description: Subsidy for transportation of ready poultry feed from outside the state of Goa by poultry farmers. To encourage farmer to go in for poultry production & increase poultry meat and egg production in the state.

procedures.step_description: Feed in its ready to use form should be purchased from any State other than Goa and brought to Goa to meet his requirements.
Farmers needing less than 3.0 tons of feed at a time should buy through Goa Bagayatdar.
Only bills of feed in terms of tons will be accepted for subsidy consideration.
Produce the bill of feed to the Taluka Veterinary Officer or Assistant Director after transporting the feed.
Give all details about feed requirements to the local officer in advance and maintain a register countersigned by the officer.

funding_pattern: Rs. 200/- per metric ton of feed purchased.
title: SUBSIDY FOR TRANSPORTATION OF READY POULTRY FEED FROM OUTSIDE THE STATE OF GOA BY POULTRY FARMERS.

criteria.description: The poultry farmer should be registered with the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services.
The farmer should be a bonafide resident of Goa for last 10 preceding years at the time of making application.
The farmer should have the Unit of Layers or Broilers within the State of Goa only.
The farmer should be a producer starting from day old chicks and sell his final produce in the market and not a trader bringing birds from outside Goa.

description: The scheme provides financial assistance for rearing broilers, layers, and low input technology poultry birds in Goa. It aims to encourage poultry production and increase meat and egg availability.  The scheme offers financial assistance for feed and chick costs, with varying amounts based on the type of bird.  It also includes provisions for existing farmers, rented farms, and registration procedures. The scheme is focused on improving economic viability and boosting sustainable poultry production in the state.

procedures.step_description: Approach the Veterinary Officer /Assistant Director of Department of A.H. & V.S. of the respective area for Registration Form, which should be duly filled in and submit to the same Officer for onward submission to the Director along with Officer's recommendation.(Form available on website)
The beneficiary should register the Poultry Farm with the Department of A.H.& V.S. and obtain the Registration Number. (form available on website). This Registration is mandatory.
The beneficiary should submit Bank Account, Bank Mandate and the Bank Account has to be Linked with Aadhar number for (DBT) Direct Benefit Transfer.

The Beneficiary should maintain (a) Livestock Register and (b) Poultry feed Register at the Farm and should be counter signed by the Area Veterinary Officer/ Assistant Director on every purchase entry.
Submit original purchase bills within 30 days of purchase.

title: Financial Assistance for Rearing Broilers, Layers and Low Input Technology Poultry Birds
funding_pattern:
The maximum quantum of Financial assistance per month will be as under:
Broiler farmer Rs. 56,000/-
Layer farmer Rs. 48,000/-
L.I.T birds farmer Rs. 4,000/-

description: The scheme provides financial assistance for the infrastructure of poultry farms in Goa. It aims to encourage poultry production in the state and reduce the burden of initial investment on farmers. The scheme offers financial assistance of 75% of the infrastructure cost, up to a maximum amount depending on the type of farm (broiler, layer, or L.I.T.).  It covers new and existing poultry farms, with specific infrastructure items eligible for assistance.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Individual having some experience in Poultry Keeping

Submit original documents for subsidy release after completion.

Sanctioning of the proposal by the Department.

The kit includes equipment like steel buckets, cans, vessels, spade, brush, steel pot, feeding trough, and a storage tank. The total value of the kit does not exceed Rs. 5000/-. Each family is entitled to one kit.

procedures.step_description: Apply using the application form.

The assistance is a one-time assistance per family.

department_name: Department of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description:
Rearing poultry birds is age old practice in rural India and is being followed till today.
The per capita availability of Eggs and chicken in urban areas ranged between 80-120 eggs and
2.25 -3.5 kgs respectively against 5-20 eggs and 750 gms of meat in rural areas.Rural families in Goa
consume rice as their staple diet which is rich in energy but low in protein .Due to protein
deficiency in rural areas the people particularly pregnant women , nursing mothers and growing
children are becoming vulnerable to many common diseases. Egg is considered as one complete
food with high protein .Backyard rearing practice of L.I.T. poultry does not involveany input expenses as the birds
are disease resistant and can feed on kitchen waste.Government of India has emphasized to popularize this birds and identified and approved
various Low input Technology birds for disseminating it to rural population.
There is high demand of poultry eggs and meat in Goan population and this huge demand
of Poultry is met by bringing it from neighboring states.
As it is decided to encourage and enable the rural farmers to venture in for poultry rearing
& increase poultry meat and egg production and there by consumption in the state, a new scheme
is framed to suit the rural beneficiary in the name “Gramashakti” . Under this scheme initial
requirement of grown up birds and feed will be provided to eligible farmers free of cost
amountingto Rs.1,000/-through Government poultry Farm once ayear.
The “Gramashakti” poultry Scheme will provide an opportunity to the rural population
to rear Low Input Technology poultry Birds in their backyard and produce required eggs and
meat for theirdaily consumptionand beself sufficient in terms of Eggs and Meat.

procedures.step_description: Approach the Veterinary Officer /Assistant Director of Department of A.H.& V.S. of the respective area for application Form.
The Director A.H.& V.S. will issue the sanction order through the respective Veterinary officer.
The grown up birds will be supplied from Government Poultry Farm Ela, Old Goa and the beneficiary have to collect the same at their own cost by submitting personal identity.

funding_pattern: Rs.1,000/- per family (Husband and wife together with unmarried children) in the form of grown up L.I.T. birds and initial feed.
title: Gramashakti - Supply of Low Input Technology Poultry Birds to Rural Farmers (2018)

description: To assist farmers in procuring dairy equipment, reduce difficulties in purchasing equipment, and boost the dairy industry by providing a 75% subsidy, up to Rs. 2.0 lakhs, on new equipment. The scheme requires farmers to apply through a prescribed form and submit necessary documents for approval. Upon approval and purchase, the subsidy is directly credited to the beneficiary’s bank account.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: All farmers having dairy Milch animals and who are bonafide residents of Goa for at least the preceding 5 years, own a cattle shed with milch animals in the state of Goa.

procedures.step_description: Apply on prescribed form in duplicate (Annexure-I).
Submit application through the local Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director.
Attach required documents (residential certificate, ID proof, affidavit, photographs, quotations).
Application scrutiny and forwarding to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services within 30 days.
Approval valid for one year.
Submission of original purchase receipts/bills and photographs within 90 days of approval.
Subsidy release within 60 days of receiving complete documents.

funding_pattern: 75% of the permissible cost of the equipment, up to Rs. 2.0 lakhs on total equipment purchased.
title: Dairy Equipment Scheme (Amended) Modified

criteria.description: 5 years residential certificate.
Self Certified copy of ration card or Election card or any other proof of identity and address issued by Government of Goa, India including Nationalized Bank.
Affidavit and Agreement signed & completed in all respects.
2 passport size photograph of the Applicant.
Quotations of the items to be purchased.

description: The major constraint in the field of dairy development in the State of Goa is the lack of green fodder for the Milch animals. The nutritive value of feed and fodder has a significant bearing on productivity of livestock. In the present Scheme the subsidy is Rs. 65000/- per hectare, and provide irrigation assistance for perennial green fodder cultivation. Provision have also been made for purchase of implements like water pump, PVC pipes, sprinklers etc with 75% subsidy on the total cost. \nIn order to cultivate Perennial Green Fodder farmers can avail tussocks free of cost from Government Livestock Farm, Dhat, Mollem , Cattle Breeding Farm, Copardem, and Fodder seed production Farm, Kalay.

procedures.step_description: Apply in prescribed form and submit to the Director of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services through the respective area Assistant Director/ Veterinary Officer.
Show proposed land area to the respective concerned Officer who will visit and confirm availability and usefulness of the land.
Prepare the Land and cultivate the proposed and approved plots within 2 months period from date of receipt of approval letter

description: The Pashupalan Scheme is designed to encourage crossbreeding and rearing of calves, uplift the S.C, S.T. & Dhangar community, improve cattle and buffalo productivity, assist farmers financially, reduce stray cattle, and conserve indigenous breeds. It consists of three phases: Artificial Insemination, pregnancy confirmation and feeding incentives, and rearing of female calves from birth to 27 months.  Subsidies are provided for AI, feed, and calf rearing, with higher rates for S.C./S.T./Dhangar communities.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: All farmers availing the Artificial Insemination Facility for cattle and buffalo and registered with the local Government Veterinary Services.
N.G.Os, Goshalas, Community Farms and other organizations availing the A.I. to cows & buffaloes.
All farmers irrespective of their financial status.

All the farmers having cross-bred female calves/improved buffalo female calves/Indigenous breed calves namely Sahiwal, Gir & Red Sindhi, either born out of A.I. or calves born to existing cows and buffaloes or bought along with animals under Kamdhenu Scheme or Western Ghat Scheme or Modern Dairy Scheme/purchased locally under any other scheme of the Government.

procedures.step_description: Register local cattle and buffaloes with the local Veterinary Dispensary or Veterinary Hospital.
Intimate the local Veterinary Centre when the animal is in estrus for AI services.
Keep the animal tied on the day of AI and two subsequent days.
Animals will be microchipped in the third month after pregnancy confirmation.
Submit monthly progress reports for pregnant animals to receive feed incentives.
Register newborn calves immediately at the nearest Veterinary Dispensary/Hospital.
Ensure calves gain at least 30 kg per quarter to continue receiving benefits.
Submit quarterly weight gain certificates for calves to receive subsidies.

valid_upto: The document mentions an amendment notification date of 01/06/2016, but doesn't explicitly state a scheme expiry date.
funding_pattern: The scheme offers varying financial incentives.  AI services are incentivized at Rs. 500 for the first AI and Rs. 200 for the second.  Pregnant animals receive Rs. 2,000 per month for feed. Calf rearing subsidies are calculated at 75% of estimated expenditures (100% for S.C./S.T./Dhangar communities) and vary by age, with amounts specified for each quarter up to 27 months.
title: Pashupalan Scheme
department_name: Department of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description: The Government of Goa has designed this Scheme in order to honour the eminent personalities in the field of Dairy Farming. This Scheme intends to appreciate the achievement of Dairy Farmers for highest individual milk production by undertaking scientific dairy Farming in the State of Goa and encourage youth to take up Dairy Business.

procedures.step_description: The eligible applicant shall apply for the award through the concerned Area Officer of the Department in prescribed format of application.
On verification of the content, the Area Officer shall recommend the same to the Director of AH & VS, Panaji-Goa for further necessary action.
On receipt of the application from the eligible applicant they will be scrutinized by the Task Force Committee constituted for the purpose by the Government.

After scrutiny of the application, the Committee shall visit the selected applicant and also at the related Dairy Co-operative Society/ Bachat Gat/ Self Help Group, for the necessary confirmation of the records.
The Task Force Committee, after complete scrutiny and confirmation of the information given by the applicant shall recommended the name of the Awardee for necessary approval by the Department.

On approval from the Department of AH & VS the Gopal Ratna Award will be declared and conferred upon the selected beneficiary on Independence Day i.e. 15th August at the hands of Honourable Chief Minister of the State.

funding_pattern: Cash prize of Rs. 1 Lakh
title: GOPAL RATNA AWARD SCHEME

criteria.description: extra ordinary contribution in the field of dairy farming by achieving highest milk production in the State
member of Dairy Co-operative society /Bachat Gat/Self help group, registered with the concerned Department
register his dairy farm with the department of Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services through the respective area officers of Veterinary Dispensary/Hospital
maintain and submit the record showing details of number of animals, stage of lactation of each animal, milk yield, date of calving, address of cattle shed etc.
bonafide resident of Goa for at least preceding five years
own cattle shed with milch animals in the State of Goa.
produce evidence of his membership from a registered Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat Gat/Self Help Groups
produce and pour minimum 1 lakh litre of milk in the preceding year (April to March) with minimum average of 250 litre of milk per day, to the Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat gat/ Self Help Group.

description: The Community Dairy Farming Scheme encourages groups of farmers to establish larger dairy units with shared infrastructure. It aims to reduce production costs, promote dairy farming as a business, achieve self-sufficiency in milk production, create employment, and provide hygienic milk.  Key features include shared resources like cattle sheds, milk parlours, and coolers, along with financial assistance through subsidies on infrastructure, equipment, and livestock.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Farmers/groups with minimum five unrelated members

procedures.step_description: Apply through Area Assistant Director/Veterinary Officer with a non-refundable processing fee of Rs. 500.
Complete the sanctioned project within six months.
Purchase milch animals after completing infrastructure and fodder cultivation (at least two months prior).
Purchase animals from Cattle Mela or outside the state (transit insurance mandatory for out-of-state purchases).
Identify animals through microchips.
Insure animals for 42 months.
Submit documents to Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services via the Financing Institution after unit completion.
Submit agreement bond for subsidy release.
Area Veterinary Officer/ Asst. Director inspects and recommends purchase of animals.

sponsors.sponsor_type: Government of Goa, Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

funding_pattern: Subsidy up to Rs. 1 Crore at 50% of permissible unit cost.
title: Community Dairy Farming Scheme (Amended 2019)

description: The Goa Cooperatives Marketing & Supply Federation Ltd, which is in financial crisis, is being provided necessary financial support of `500.00 lakhs by way of Interest Free Loan to strengthen its financial base and increase its business activities during the XIth Five Year Plan period. During the years 2008-09 to 2011-12 the financial support of `375.00 lakhs each have been provided to the Federation by way of Interest Free Loan to streamline its business activities.\n\nThe Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Karkhana is the only Sugar Factory in the State. With a view to protect the interest of cane growers in the State and to enable the Karkhana to overcome the financial difficulties, the State Government provides financial support to the Karkhana by way of Share Capital Contribution/ Medium Term loan. The Sugar Factory has decided to increase its sugar production, which will enable it to mobilize funds to undertake modernization of the old and out dated machinery for improving its efficiency. During the year 2011-12, the financial support by way of share capital contribution of `2.50 crores have been provided to the karkhana and subsidy of `172.00 lakhs as a support price to the Goan Cane Cultivators.
