description:
The Goa State Library (Financial Assistance) Amendment Rules, 2004, provides financial assistance to libraries run by Non-Government Institutions.

**Network of Libraries:**
* Central Library (State)
* District Libraries
* Taluka Libraries
* Panchayat Libraries /Village Libraries

**Management:**
Government manages state, district, taluka, and village libraries. Existing non-Government taluka/village libraries run by Municipalities/NGOs continue under the same management. Panchayat libraries are managed through Gram Panchayats or NGOs registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860.

**Grant-in-aid:**
Released to Gram Panchayats, NGOs, or municipal councils in two installments:
1. After receiving the annual report by May 31st.
2. After receiving the audited statement by October 31st.

**Token Grant:** Rs. 50,000 for new public libraries if conditions are met.

**Eligibility:** Only registered NGOs with approved library management rules are eligible.
Existing NGO libraries must fulfill all conditions.

**Taluka Libraries:**
1. Up to Rs. 1.20 lakhs for manpower (max 3 persons).
2. 100% assistance on other admissible items up to Rs. 1.50 lakhs.

**Panchayat/Village Libraries:**
1. Up to Rs. 60,000 for manpower (max 2 persons).
2. 100% assistance on other admissible items up to Rs. 60,000.

**Conditions for Eligibility:**
1. Suitable premises (40 sq. mts).
2. Maintain required registers and files.
3. Minimum operating hours: 6.5 hrs for Taluka Libraries, 6 hrs for Panchayat Libraries (3 hrs morning, 3 hrs evening).
4. Display timings and holidays.
5. Open for inspection and audit.
6. Submit annual report by May 30th and audited statement by October 30th.
7. Separate bank account.

**Admissible Expenses:**
* Staff salaries
* Rent
* Repairs
* Books, periodicals, etc.
* Catalogues, reports, etc.
* Furniture and equipment
* Insurance
* Contingencies (stationery, postage, etc.)
* Miscellaneous expenses (group discussions, etc.)
* World Book Day, Librarian Day, National Book Week celebrations.

**Withdrawal of Grant:**
Non-compliance or misuse may lead to withholding or recovery of grants.

**Undertaking:**
Management must hand over government-funded materials upon grant withdrawal and compensate for any loss or damage.
title: Goa State Library (Financial Assistance) Amendment Rules, 2004

description: Scheme for Breeding of Local Cows in the State of Goa\n\nThe scheme aims to improve and sustain local livestock productivity through Artificial Insemination, compensate farmers for time spent consulting veterinarians, financially assist stall-feeding, and indirectly reduce stray animals. It addresses challenges like low productivity, limited feed resources, diseases, lack of farmer organizations, and poor nutrition. The scheme targets crossbreeding local cattle to improve milk production quantity and quality, while preserving native breeds and promoting sustainable livelihoods for small farmers.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Farmers owning local cattle, especially in rural areas
Farmers with local cattle in urban areas (priority to reduce stray cattle)
NGOs and other organizations rearing local cattle

procedures.step_description:
Phase 1: Artificial Insemination

* Farmer registers local cattle with Veterinary Dispensary/Hospital.
* Farmer informs Veterinary Centre when animal shows heat symptoms.
* Farmer receives Rs. 100 per AI after procedure.
* Cow must be tied for three days (AI day + two subsequent days).
* Only one repeat AI cycle is incentivized at Rs. 100.

Phase 2: Pregnancy Confirmation and Feed Incentive

* Animals are microchipped in the third month after pregnancy confirmation.
* Veterinarian recommends the case to Head Office for feed incentive.
* Farmer receives feed incentive from the 4th month onwards (2.5 kg/day/animal for six months).
* Local Veterinary Doctors receive a reserve fund of up to Rs. 1000 for cash payments (monitored by Assistant Director, KVSc, under Deputy Director (Gyn)).
* Feed allowance is discontinued in case of abortion/death.
* Non-stall feeding can lead to reconsideration of feed allowance.

description: To set up New Poultry Units of either 500 Broilers or 1000 Layers.

procedures.step_description: Approach the Government Veterinary /Doctor of the respective area for Application Form, which should be duly filled in and submit to the same Officer for onward transmission to the Director along with Officer’s recommendation.

The application will be scrutinized by the Directorate and then referred to the Financial Institutions indicated by the applicant. Loan is must and can be availed only from Bank and not Credit Societies.
The applicant has to arrange for the loan from the Bank.

After obtaining the loan the applicant can start with the construction after obtaining all the Licenses/N.O.C from, Gram Panchyat/Municipality and Health Department, or any other relevant authorities.
Once the project is completed and commissioned, the utilization Certificate may be obtained from the Veterinary Officer and Bank Manager.

The Bank will then claim the subsidy from the Department by forwarding the application submitted by the beneficiary, together with purchase statement, purchase receipts, utilization certificate, Insurance documents, Agreement Bond duly signed by the beneficiary and two witnesses signed in presence of area Veterinary Doctor.
The beneficiary can purchase either 500 days old broilers or 1000 days layer chicks.
The units are to be run for a minimum period of three (3) years.
The beneficiary should make his own arrangements to market the produce.

description: Modified scheme for purchase of milch animals under Western Ghat Development Programme (WGDP) to boost milk production and promote self-employment in the dairy sector, especially in the Western Ghat talukas. The scheme provides financial assistance for the purchase of crossbred cows and improved breed she buffaloes. Special attention is being given to the farmers of this backward Talukas. Thus progress in livestock sector is directly related to a more balanced development of rural economy and upliftment of the poor sections of the society. Dairying with crossbred cattle and high yielding buffaloes has become a remunerative business. The main reason for the success of the dairy programme in India is the involvement of milk producers in setting up their own organizations for milk production enhancement, milk procurement, processing and marketing. Dairying, as a subsidiary source of income, is a real relief to most of these weaker groups in society.

department_name: Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description: According to a rough estimate there are around 30,000 stray dogs in this State. A number of them were not cared for and are left either wounded or suffering from various diseases. Government of Goa is concerned about the suffering of stray animals on the streets and has come up with a Scheme to reduce the suffering of the stray dog population. Unregulated breeding has resulted in large number of sick and starving dogs and puppies on the streets and beaches. The Corporation, Municipalities and Panchayats will work with Mission Rabies, Worldwide Veterinary Services, India in the State to try to scientifically reduce and manage the number of strays by sterilizing them and vaccinating them against Rabies, resulting in control of the stray dog populations as well as protecting them against Rabies. The dogs once vaccinated against Rabies, cases of Rabies in humans will also reduce in the State. The main goal is to improve the welfare of stray dog populations through a comprehensive sterilization programme carried out as part of the animal birth control (ABC) scheme, under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act 1960, and rules made there under.\nMission Rabies, Worldwide Veterinary Services, India have formulated a programme in Goa keeping in mind two main Aims i.e. Eradication of Rabies disease and Rabies free Goa. The programme was framed in 2 Phases. The Phase I is already completed by them by covering Sterilization of 20414 dogsand Vaccinating about 35,500 dogs by utilizing their own funds as said in their Reports.\nNow, the organization has approached the State Govt. requesting to extend financial support in Phase II in the form of Grant in Aid(ABC) scheme, under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act 1960, and rules made there under.

procedures.step_description: Mission Rabies, Worldwide Veterinary Services, India authorized by the Animal Welfare Board of India shall sign MOU with the Govt. of Goa & apply for grants to the Director of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services to cover the jurisdiction of whole state in application form appended hereto marked as Annexure-I.
On verification of the contents of the application the Director of Animal Husbandry & veterinary Services shall recommend the state Govt. for necessary sanction.

The headquarter of the beneficiary should be established in proper premises having taken required NOC from the building owner and also should take necessary NOC from the Statutory Authorities, which shall be essential prerequisite to release the grants.

On approval of the scheme by Govt. the Department of AH & VS shall sanction & release the grants to be disbursed to the concerned body through the Electronic Clearing System (ECS), for which the applicant shall have to provide their Bank details needed for ECS at the time of submission of required Documents and Certificates asked by the Department.

To avoid duplication of grants to the AWO from the Animal Welfare Board of India and under this Scheme, the Dept. shall thoroughly scrutinize the Documents through the Monitoring Committee and disburse the yearly grant only within the components as specified under the Scheme in 2 Installments.
A Nodal Officer of sufficient seniority of the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services should be nominated to liaise with the project on a daily basis.

An audit committee consisting of the project leader and subordinate official of the project along with a nodal officer from the Dept. Of AH & VS should look into spending expenditure and report to the Govt.

The local Assistant Directors, North & South of Directorate of AH&VS appointed as Verifying Officers for the said Scheme in whose jurisdiction the AWO works will verify and certify the Bills/Vouchers towards the costs of the components as submitted in the application and submit the same to Mission Rabies as required under the existing administrative, legal and financial regulations

A State Level Committee chaired under the Hon. Minister of Animal Husbandry along with the Secretary (AH), Director of AH, Dir. of Municipal Admn., Dir. of Panchayat Administration, Director of Tourism, Director of Health, Director of Education and Director/Manager of Mission Rabies as Members of the Committee to be formed to continuously monitor the progress of work and review the project work periodically. (Atleast twice a year).

Two District Level Committee, one for North Goa and another for South Goa under the chairmanship of respective Deputy Collector with representative of municipalities, Panchayats, Health, ADEI, Block Development Officers and Mission Rabies Manager may be formed to review the progress of the project periodically (Semi Annually)

Monthly reports on number of dogs vaccinated, number of dogs not vaccinated, number of dogs positive or suspected for Rabies which were euthanized, stray dog population, pet dog population, human dog bite cases, human Rabies deaths, latest statistics, number of children and adults educated should be submitted to the Education, Statistics and Animal Husbandry Departments compulsorily.

introduced_on: The date of enforcement of MOU
funding_pattern: 100% grant in aid from state Govt. initially for a year and after that depending on the Assessment it can be extended for 2 years.

description: To motivate farmers to undertake piggery production.\nTo upgrade local stock to make piggery farming profitable.\nTo make state self sufficient in pork production.

procedures.step_description:
Beneficiary should submit the application for setting up of piggery unit for 20
Sows and 2 boars to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services,
Panaji in the prescribed form through the respective Veterinary Officer/ Assistant
Director of his jurisdiction.
N.O.C. from the respective Village Panchayat for setting up the Piggery unit\nshould be enclosed along with application form.

The Beneficiary can set up the Piggery unit with his own finance or by taking loan\nfrom any financing Institutions of his/her choice. In case of loan from the Bank,\nthe subsidy should be disbursed directly to the loanees account.

The beneficiary can purchase the pigglings from the Government Piggery Farm,
Curti Ponda Goa. In case the pigglings are not available in the Govt. piggery
farm, he can purchase the required number of pigglings from any other private
Farm in consultation with the respective Veterinary Officer / Assistant Director.
The beneficiary should set up the unit within 3 months from the date of sanction,\nof the application

Only on receipt of utilization certificate and all other required receipts etc form the
respective Veterinary Officer / Assistant Director the subsidy will be released to
the beneficiary. In case he has availed Bank finance for setting up of the unit, the
subsidy will be released to the Bank to be credited to the Beneficiary’s loan
account.
Before release of the subsidy the beneficiary has to execute the Bond stating that\nthe unit will not be closed for a minimum period of 3 years from the date of\nrelease of subsidy.
The beneficiary should vaccinate the pigs regularly against Swine fever Disease,\non the direction of the local Assistant Director/Veterinary Office.
The insurance of the pigs is optional and the beneficiary can insure the pigs, if\nhe/she so desires, at his /her own cost.

description: The Government of India has introduced Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) which is a credit linked subsidy programme to generate employment in rural as well as in urban areas of the State. The scheme shall be implemented in the rural areas by KVIC/KVIB and in the urban and rural areas by the District Industries centre. The scheme shall be monitored by the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of India.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Special Category (including SC/ST /OBC /Minorities / Women/ Ex-servicemen / physically handicapped

procedures.step_description: The Beneficiaries shall submit the proposal in the prescribed format along with other documents.
The proposals shall be placed before the District Level Taskforce constituted for scrutiny of the proposals. The Task force may call the applicants for interview on the stipulated day.
After the approval of the Task force, the proposals shall be forwarded to the Bank selected by the applicant. All public sector Banks are covered under PMEGP
The Bank shall appraise the proposals technically and economically and shall take its own credit decision after ensuring that the projects fulfill the criteria of the PMEGP.
No Collateral security shall be insisted upon in line with the guidelines of the RBI for projects up to Rs 10 lakhs.
Normal rate of interest shall be charged by the Banks. The repayment schedule may range between 3 to 7 years after an initial moratorium as may be prescribed by the Bank.

After the project is sanctioned by the Bank, the beneficiary shall be deputed for EDP training at the designated EDP centers for undergoing training of two weeks. Those who have undergone such training through reputed training centers need not be deputed for the training.
After completion of the EDP training the beneficiary shall deposit 5% or 10% own contribution with the Bank. Thereafter the Bank shall release the first installment of loan.

After the release of the Bank finance either partly or fully, the Bank shall forward the margin money claim to its nodal branch in Panaji, in the prescribed format. The nodal branch shall remit the margin money to the financing Bank.

The margin money released by the nodal branch shall be kept as the TDR in the financing Bank for a period of three years in the name of the beneficiary, which shall be adjusted after three years from the date of first disbursement of loan with the consent of the KVIC/KVIB/DIC.

The margin money is a one-time assistance. For any enhancement of credit, the margin money shall not be available. Only one project shall be sanctioned in one family (family is defined as person and the spouse)

Though the margin money is released, the KVIC/KVIB/DIC will be the final authority to accept or reject the project/subsidy based on the parameters of the scheme. The KVIC/KVIB/DIC shall have the right to recall the subsidy if the project fails to fulfill the criteria of the scheme.
All the units assisted under PMEGP should display a sign board indicating that the unit is assisted under PMEGP.
All units shall be physically verified by the officials of the KVIB/KVIC/DIC or any other agency authorized for undertaking such verifications.

funding_pattern: 10% to 35% subsidy based on category and location.
introduced_on: Not specified in document but implied as past.
title: Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)

description:
Goa is full of art and artists, however, it lacks proper infrastructure, especially in the interiors, in the form of auditoriums and theaters. Existing facilities are often inadequate. To address this, the government has initiated the construction of Ravindra Bhavans/Kala Bhavans with modern facilities.

Ravindra Bhavans are equipped with state-of-the-art facilities like air-conditioned auditoriums (900+ capacity), VIP rooms, green rooms, rehearsal halls, security, conference halls, cafeterias, landscaping, service buildings, parking, administrative blocks, art galleries, music and dance schools, classrooms, and other amenities.

Technical aspects like acoustics, sound, lighting, and stage equipment meet international standards. The project also focuses on providing training to nurture upcoming talent and enriching the art and culture scene.

These complexes serve as much-needed infrastructure for cultural education and performances. They are open to public performances and established based on public demand and fund availability.

description:
The objectives of the scheme are as follows:
*To give state recognition to the local artists receiving National Award.
*To appreciate local talents and promote local artists.
*To give financial support to local artists.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Goan artist who has received National/International Awards

procedures.step_description: For better implementation of the scheme the Government shall constitute a sub-committee.

Sub-committee shall meet as and when required and shall consider the names of the artists for reward under this scheme for the particular year (recipient of a National Award as indicated in 2(i) of previous financial year shall be considered by the Sub-committee).

However, for the first year of commencement of this scheme, all the names who are eligible under clause 2(ii) shall be considered by the Sub-committee. After scrutiny and selection of the artists, Sub-committee shall submit its recommendations to the Director of Art & Culture.

Once recommendations are received from Sub-committee, the Directorate of Art & Culture shall present the financial purse, memento and the certificate of appreciation in the felicitation programme organized by the Directorate of Art & Culture after obtaining due approval from the Government.

criteria.description:
A Goan artist who has received any of the following National Awards shall be eligible for this scheme: -
*Sahitya Akademi Award
*Sangeet Natak Akademi Award
*Lalit Kala Akademi Award
*Padma Award for the contribution in the field of art & culture (for literature, music, dance, theatre, fine art, folk art etc.)
*Bhartiya Dnyanpeeth Award
*Saraswati Sanman
*Sahitya Akademi Jivan Gaurav Puraskar (Life time Achievement award)
*Sangeet Natak Academy Fellowship
*Any other National or International Award specially recognized by the Government of Goa for the purpose of this scheme from time to time.
Sahitya Akademi Award for translation will not be consider for this scheme. So also, only main awards given by the above esteemed institutions shall be considered for this scheme.
Under this scheme an artist shall be eligible to receive to receive benefit only once, although he gets more than one award from amongst above mentioned awards.
Those living artists who have already received such awards stated at 2(i) shall also be eligible for this scheme. However, no award shall be given posthumously.
(Explanation: for the purpose of this scheme Goan artist means an artist who has spent at least 10 years in Goa out of his / her total creative lifetime).

criteria.description: The Library should have suitable and independent premises of about 40 Sqmts. with proper lighting and ventilation.
The Library should maintain all registers and files required for smooth functioning of the library.

The timings of the Taluka Libraries should be minimum of 6 ½ hrs on all working days in accordance with the needs of public. The Panchayat Library should function for at least 6 hrs. on all working days. In the morning session, it should function for 3 hrs. from 7.30 a.m. to 10.30 a.m. and in the evening session from 4.30 p.m. to 7.30 p.m. The Taluka and Village Libraries will follow a 6 day week. Adjustment timing may be permitted as per the local needs.
The timing of the Library and the list of holidays for Library should be displayed outside the Library Building/Room.

The Library shall be open for inspection audited by the Director of School Education or Library Officer or by a Representative of State Library Committee/State Library Council. All records registers etc. shall be made available for scrutiny for the Inspecting Officer.
The Management shall submit an annual report by 30th May and audited statement of the Library expenditure of previous, duly audited by Chartered Accountant, latest by 30th October every year.
A Library seeking grants shall have a separate Bank Account in the name of the library.

description: The Gomant Vibhushan Award is designed to honor and recognize Goan renowned personalities who have contributed distinguished and extraordinary achievements/services in any field of activities/disciplines at national & international level.

procedures.step_description: The Department of Art & Culture shall invite recommendations by release of advertisement in local newspapers.

Recommendations will be accepted from sources like Chief Minister/Governor of Goa State, Ministers, Members of the Legislative Assembly, Members of Parliament, Government Departments of Goa and also private individuals, bodies etc.

The committee constituted for the purpose of this scheme may suo-moto take cognizance of the life time achievement/contribution of the eminent personalities of Goan origin whose proposals are not received.

A Selection Committee under the Chairmanship of Chief Minister of Goa shall meet as and when required and shall consider the recommendation received as well as consider the names suo-moto at its own level and do selection of the “Gomant Vibhushan Awardee” and submit its recommendation to the Director of Art & Culture.
The Director of Art & Culture shall obtain the acceptance of concerned personality to receive the “Gomant Vibhushan Award”.

After obtaining such acceptance, the Director of Art & Culture shall honour the personality by presenting Memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse in the felicitation programme organized by the Department of Art & Culture after obtaining due approval of the Government.

No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during the process of selection if death of such artist occurs after recommendation of the name, then Task Force Committee may consider his name for “award”, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously.
No individual shall be eligible for second time to avail the benefit under this scheme.

description:
The major constraint in the field of dairy development in the State of Goa is the lack of green fodder for the Milch animals. The nutritive value of feed and fodder has a significant bearing on productivity of livestock; as such a provision of the Green Fodder for feeding Milch animals is very essential. Keeping this in view, fodder development has been made an integral part of Livestock development.

In the present scheme, the subsidy is Rs. 65,000/- per hectare, and provides irrigation assistance to take up the perennial green fodder cultivation having water source. Provision has also been made for the purchase of implements like water pump, PVC pipes, sprinklers, etc. with 75% subsidy on the total cost.

In order to cultivate Perennial Green Fodder, farmers can avail tussocks free of cost from Government Livestock Farm, Dhat, Mollem, Cattle Breeding Farm, Copardem, and Fodder Seed Production Farm, Kalay.
title: Scheme for incentive to Green Fodder Cultivation for Perennial and Seasonal Fodder Development in the State (Amended) 2017-18
