description: The average area of cultivation under the Sugarcane crop in the State has remained static over the year so also the average production. It is important to improve the productivity and area under sugarcane crop so that the crop is more remunerative for farmers and also there is adequate supply of cane to the only sugar factory in co-operative sector in the State. This can be achieved by bringing new areas under the crop and by following Modified Sustainable Sugarcane Initiative (MSSI) techniques by the cultivators.

procedures.step_description: The farmers desirous of claiming assistance under the scheme shall apply to Zonal Agricultural Officer online in prescribed form alongwith scanned copy of certificate issued by Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Kharkhana Ltd., Goa, stating that he is registered grower with them and has brought ‘X’ M2 new area under sugarcane crop during the year by following MSSI guidelines.

Zonal Agricultural Officer shall verify the correctness of the claim/verification on site and determine the admissible amount of the assistance to the farmer as per the expenditure receipts/vouchers produced in support of the claim.
The claim thus received shall be uploaded for the scrutiny and sanction by the District Agriculture Officer, South/North-Goa.

funding_pattern: Rs. 10,000/- per ha. towards the cost of land preparation and planting of single bud seedlings. The assistance will be 50% of the cost of expenditure on labour charges or Rs. 10,000/- per ha. whichever is less.
title: Promotion of Modified Sustainable Sugarcane Initiative (MSSI)

description: Assistance to Goan students seeking education in any field of Art & Culture outside Goa.
title: Scheme to provide Assistance to students seeking education outside Goa

description: The scheme envisages organization of Cultural talent search competition for the Government/Non- Government, Middle/ High school students in Music/ Dance/ Drama(Monologue)/ Drawing/ Painting/ Poem Writing/Essay writing/Handwriting and providing scholarships to the 1st prize winners at state level in each field for developing their talent.

procedures.step_description: The Directorate of Art and Culture shall release an advertisement/press note in the local newspapers regarding the organization of the Cultural Talent Search Competition for the student enrolled in recognized schools. Also a circular will be issued to the schools in this regard.

The school shall furnish the names of interested eligible students to participate in the talent contest at taluka level. Those students who secure first three ranks at the Taluka level in each event shall automatically be eligible for the State level competition and the 1st rank holder at State level shall be eligible for grants of scholarship, subject to the provisions made under clause 4(iii) and 5.
An individual school shall be eligible to participate in all the events, however only three entries in each individual event shall be accepted from each school.

The parent/guardian of students who secured 1st prize in the State level competition shall submit the application for grant of scholarship in prescribed format after necessary recommendation from the guru/institution where the student will be receiving basic or advanced education in the field of Music/ Dance/ Drama(Monologue)/ Drawing/ Painting/ Poem Writing/Essay writing/Handwriting

funding_pattern: scholarship
title: The Cultural Talent Search Competition and Scholarship Scheme

criteria.description: The student should be enrolled in a recognized Government/Government aided institution in the State of Goa and shall participate in the cultural talent search competition organized by the Directorate of Art & Culture.

The student who secures first prize in the talent search competition at the State level in the event and intends to seek basic or advanced education in Music/ Dance/ Drama(Monologue)/ Drawing/ Painting/ Poem Writing/Essay writing/Handwriting from guru / institution shall be eligible for scholarship under the scheme.

The students who have secured the 1st prize in the competition will not be allowed to participate in that field of competition again however, he may compete for other events if the school nominates. The 2nd and/ or 3rd prize in the talent search competition held earlier at the State level shall also be eligible to participate in the subsequent editions of the talent competitions. However in the event of such a student securing first prize, shall not be eligible for an additional scholarship.
The students receiving scholarship from any other Government or non-Government bodies towards similar training shall not be eligible scholarship under this scheme.

description: The Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar) scheme recognizes and honors young Goan artists (aged 25-40) for their exceptional achievements and contributions to the field of Art & Culture.

procedures.step_description: Department of Art & Culture releases a press advertisement inviting recommendations from eminent institutions/individuals.
The department may also directly write to institutions/individuals for recommendations.
The committee (term of 3 years) can also suo-moto consider artists.
Selected artists are contacted for acceptance.
Felicitation program organized by the Department of Art & Culture to honor the awardees.

funding_pattern: Rs. 25,000 per awardee
title: Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar)

criteria.description: An individual artist between the age of 25-40 years (with possible relaxation of up to 5 years in exceptional cases) who has made an extraordinary contribution to Art & Culture.
The artist should have contributed to their field of art in Goa for at least 5 years of their career as a practicing artist.
No posthumous awards except in cases where the artist dies after being recommended.
No artist can receive the award twice.
A maximum of 6 individuals across various art forms (Music/Dance, Drama/Tiatr, Folk Art, Photography/Painting, Craft, Sculpture, Bhajan/Kirtan, Literature, Film) will be considered each year.

description:
Industrial Training Institutes (ITI) have been set up under the Craftsmen
Training Scheme (CTS) with an objective to ensure steady flow of skilled
personnel to the public and private sectors, and to reduce unemployment
amongst the educated youth by equipping them with required skills,
education and discipline. There are 10 Govt. and 6 Pvt. ITIs in the State of
Goa imparting training in various Engineering and Non engineering trade
courses. Most of the trades and units available in these Institutes are
affiliated to the National Council for Vocational Training (NCVT), New Delhi
through Directorate General of Training (DGT), Ministry of Skill
Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE), Government of India, New
Delhi and training is imparted as per the syllabus and curriculum approved
by Government of India in consultation with NCVT. However, some of the
trades/units in these it is are affiliated to State Council for Vocational
Training(SCVT),Panaji-Goa.
title: Craftsmen TrainingScheme

description: The DGT, Govt. of India has implemented Vocational Training Improvement Project (VTIP) scheme with assistance from World Bank. Under the VTIP scheme, 07 Government ITI’s have been upgraded into Centres of Excellence through the Scheme funded with assistance from the World Bank on a 75:25 GoI : State share basis. The Vasco Govt ITI is being upgraded into a Centre of Excellence through a GoI Scheme “Upgradation of 1396 Govt ITIs under PPP” model. The remaining 02 ITIs i.e. Mapusa and Panaji Govt ITIs have already been upgraded into CoEs under domestic funding. Further, Panaji Govt ITI is being upgraded into model ITI under GoI scheme: Upgradation of existing Govt ITI into m Model ITI and tripartite Memorandum of Agreement (MoA) has been signed between the Industry Partner,theState Govtand GoI.
funding_pattern: 75:25 GoI : State share basis
title: Centre of Excellence (CoE)

description: This scheme is implemented on the shop-floor of industries and establishments brought under the ambit of Apprenticeship Act 1961 from the public and private sectors.
title: Apprenticeship TrainingScheme (ATS)

description:
Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY), version 2.0, under
Centrally sponsored State Managed (CSSM) component is a fully funded
flagship Skill Development programme of Govt of India with a vision of a
“Skilled India”, with aim to skill India on a large scale with speed and high
standards.
The objective of this Skill Certification Scheme is to enable a large number
of Indian youth to take up industry-relevant skill training that will help
themin securingabetter livelihood.
Under this Scheme, Training and Assessment fees are completely paid by
the Government.
funding_pattern: Fully funded
title: Pradhan Mantri KaushalVikas Yojana (PMKVY)

description:
SANKALPProject
Skills Acquisition and Knowledge Awareness for Livelihood (SANKALP)
project aims to implement the mandate of the National Skill
Development Mission (NSDM), through its core sub-missions. The
project will be implemented in mission mode through World Bank
supportandalignedwith the overallobjectivesofthe NSDM.
SANKALP aims at convergence in short term vocational training
ecosystem andbetween short&long termvocationaleducation.
Themain objectivesof the projectincludes:-
a) Strengthened institutional mechanism at National and State levels to
guideplanning,deliveryand monitoring of marketrelevanttraining,
b) Improve qualityand marketrelevanceof SkillDevelopmentprograms
c) Improve access to and completion of skills training for female
traineesand otherdisadvantagegroupsand
d) Expandingskillstrainingthroughprivate–publicpartnership(PPP).
The proposal pertaining to the State of Goa is submitted to MSDE, Govt.
of India on 10/12/2018 for approval, however, a revised proposal is to be
submitted inlinewith revisedguidelinesissued byMSDE, GoI.
funding_pattern: World Bank support
title: SANKALP

description: This project is a World Bank Assisted Government of India program with the objective of improving the relevance and efficiency of skill training provided through ITI’s and apprenticeships and is 100% funded GoI Project.
title: Skill Strengthening for Industrial Value Enhancement (STRIVE)
funding_pattern: 100% funded GoI Project

description: The main Objective of this Society is to provide training courses in Engineering & Non Engineering of six months /one year duration, in various disciplines, through Private Institutes whose above courses are affiliated to the Society as per the norms laid down by it. The HRDF Society has been registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860.Thereare total51 Institute registeredunderHRDF.
title: Manpower Development, through Human Resource Development Foundation (HRDF)Society

description: The Goa State Incentives to Encourage Investments Scheme, 2017\" to be called as the ‘Umbrella Scheme’ to provide for financial assistance to the enterprises in the State of Goa.

procedures.step_description: All units eligible under the target schemes should apply to the Director, Directorate of Industries, Trade and Commerce (DITC)
The applications shall be filed as per the timeline mentioned in Schedule A.
The applications for each target scheme shall be accepted and placed before the Task Force Committee only during the time period as specified in Schedule A.

funding_pattern: The amount provided in the above budget heads shall be transferred to a Public Ledger Account (PLA) to be opened by the DITC. Funds transferred to this account shall not lapse.
title: The Goa State Incentives to Encourage Investments Scheme

description: This scheme provides a subsidy of Rs.100 per clay idol (minimum 1ft height) to local artisans registered with GHRSSIDC. The scheme aims to revive the traditional clay idol-making industry and support local artisans facing competition from cheaper alternatives. The subsidy is applicable to idols used for religious festivals and sold to the public, with a maximum limit of 250 idols per artisan per year.  Unsold idols are not covered.

procedures.step_description: Artisans registered with GHRSSIDC submit applications in the prescribed format.
GHRSSIDC scrutinizes applications and verifies production capacity.
Artisans submit an undertaking stating idols are locally produced.
GHRSSIDC officials visit manufacturing units for physical verification.
Artisans maintain records of idols produced and sold.
Appraisal Committee scrutinizes applications and approves subsidies.
Subsidy is disbursed to artisans via cheque.

sponsors.sponsor_type: Goa Handicrafts, Rural and Small Scale Industries Development Corporation Ltd. (GHRSSIDC)

funding_pattern: Government reimburses the subsidy to GHRSSIDC. 50% released upon scheme implementation, balance after utilization certificate.
title: Scheme for providing subsidy for Clay Idol Makers

criteria.description: Registered with GHRSSIDC
Idols made of clay
Minimum idol size of 1ft height
Idols are used for religious festivals (Ganesh Chaturthi, Christmas, etc.) and sold to the public.

department_name: Goa Handicrafts, Rural & Small Scale Industries Development Corporation Ltd.

description: The Goa Youth Rojgar Yojana Scheme aims to reduce unemployment by providing self-employment opportunities. It offers financial assistance and infrastructure support for various ventures, including cashew processing units and vending kiosks. The scheme is implemented through the Goa Handicrafts, Rural, and Small Scale Industries Development Corporation Ltd (GHRSSIDC).
funding_pattern: Government-funded.
title: Goa Youth Rojgar Yojana Scheme

criteria.description: Minimum 15 years of domicile in Goa.
Up to 40 years of age (with some exceptions).
Minimum educational qualification of 8th standard (with some exceptions).

description: One-time financial assistance for Self Help Groups.
funding_pattern: One-time assistance
title: SEED CAPITAL LOAN SCHEME FOR SELF HELP GROUPS 2010
documents: List of members with office bearers

description: The Self Help Groups (SHG) in rural and urban areas are to be encouraged to take up income generating enterprises under industries, and services which are Non-farm sector activities by contributing their resources and to get one time non-recurring grant of 50% of the project cost from Government to the extent of Rs.50,000/- as seed capital and deposit the same in the name of Self Help Group in the Bank account. The balance part of the seed capital, the loan part to the extent of 45% shall be made available through the Village Co-operative Bank Branches, Economic Development Corporation (EDC), branches of the nationalized banks or other micro finance companies. The SHG shall contribute 5% of the project cost.

procedures.step_description: The President and Secretary of the SHG submit a joint application to the Managing Director, GHRSSIDCL.
The application should be accompanied by required documents.
The SHG deposits its 5% contribution with the bank.
The bank or EDC finances 45% of the project cost after project approval.
The bank or EDC claims the 50% seed capital from the Director of Industries, Trade & Commerce.
The seed capital is credited to the SHG's bank account.
The SHG undertakes to recover the loan from its customers.

title: Seed Capital Loan Scheme For Self Help Groups 2011
funding_pattern: 50% grant, 45% loan, 5% SHG contribution

criteria.description: Registered with the Registrar of Co-operative Societies under Cooperative Societies Act or with the State Registrar as a Society under the Societies Registration Act 1860 and engaged in the non-farm sector activities.
Engaged in business activity/trading organized under the Non-Farm sector.
Carrying out activities falling under the Industries or Service Sector.

documents: Entrepreneurship Memorandum Part I (EM Part I)

description: Scheme to create self employment opportunities in the state of Goa by providing training programmes in various handicrafts and allied items, design development and technology upgradation workshops for capacity building. The scheme will be implemented by Goa Handicrafts, Rural & Small Scale Industries Development Corporation Ltd. (GHRSSIDC).
funding_pattern: Rs.50,000/- per training. Includes raw materials (Rs.20,000/-), trainer and coordinator fees (Rs.20,000/-), and advertisement/publicity (Rs.10,000/-). Specialized training programmes have variable budgets.
title: Training Programme “CONDUCTING TRAINING PROGRAMMES IN VARIOUS HANDICRAFTS AND ALLIED ITEMS, DESIGN DEVELOPMENT AND TECHNOLOGY UPGRADATION WORKSHOPS FOR CAPACITY BUILDING AND TO CREATE SELF- EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY FOR URBAN & RURAL YOUTH / WOMEN, AND UN-EMPLOYED PERSONS”

criteria.description: Residents of Goa holding domicile certificate / Electoral Identity Card.
A minimum of 30% of the programmes shall be organized exclusively for mahila mandals/women self help groups/cooperative societies formed by women.
At least 30% of the programmes shall be targeted towards members of S.C/S.T/ OBC communities.

description: The Government of Goa has formulated a scheme for the promotion of Goan handicrafts and to create sustainable self-employment opportunities. The scheme, titled \"MARKETING SUPPORT AND DOCUMENTATION OF GOAN HANDICRAFTS\", aims to increase awareness about Goan handicrafts, develop a strong brand name for Aparant Goan Handicrafts, create a unique identity and positioning for Goan handicrafts, document, preserve and revive old, rare and languishing Goan handicrafts items, provide adequate infrastructure support for improved quality and productivity and to enable artisan access to a larger market segment, both domestic and international, and provide marketing opportunities to local artisans by organizing exhibitions, buyer seller meets, within India and abroad for marketing their products.
funding_pattern: The scheme will cover various costs such as honoraria to experts, printing of books, leaflets, pamphlets, folders, travelling allowance for researchers/authors, cost involved in CD ROM, DVDs, photo cum video documentation, printing and framing of photographs on Goan handicrafts, website development, creative designs, website maintenance, tie-up with payment gateway, photography, advertisement and publicity, hoardings, banners, posters, advertisements in magazines, newspapers, developing traffic islands, promotion of Goan handicrafts by participating in national and international road shows, exhibitions, events, fashion shows, transportation of samples, purchase of samples, advertisements in international publications and travel magazines, organizing competitions and sponsoring various cultural programmes, printing of t-shirts, bags, making short films and documentaries, CDs, calendars and diaries, bar coding and photo documentation of Goan handicrafts, installation of bar code software and hardware, organizing \"Aparant Maand\", an annual mega exhibition cum sale of handicrafts, providing stalls to Goan Artisans, paying daily allowance to participating artisans, transportation of goods, travel of artisans, cost of stay cum hospitality, cultural programmes, publicity for the Maand, exhibitions, handicrafts sale, participation in important handicrafts trade fairs, travel, stay, hire of hall, related facilities, transportation of goods.
title: MARKETING SUPPORT AND DOCUMENTATION OF GOAN HANDICRAFTS

description:
The scheme is intended to facilitate continuous interacting sessions at different levels in order to focus on policy issues, sharing of experiences of different artisan groups in other states so as to enable the GHRSSIDC to evolve strategies that can enable sustainable development of Goan handicrafts. 
Nature of Scheme:
a) In this scheme a group of 20 – 30 artisan’s from within the state will be selected by the corporation and will be sent on interstate study tours of 10 to 12 days duration. The study tour will be conducted by the GHRSSIDC and the artisans will be taken to centers of excellence, craft villages, handicrafts clusters, exhibitions and emporia of other states. This will enable the local artisans to establish closer ties with artisans of other states.
b) The artisans will also be reimbursed the travel cost equivalent to 2nd class to and fro railway fare and shall be provided D.A. @ 275 per day in case of A-1 class cities and Rs.200/- per day in case of other cities where the artisans shall participate in various exhibitions/crafts melas etc. so as to enable them to sell their products outside Goa. This will also help in popularizing Goan handicrafts among people of other regions. The financial assistance will be provided per beneficiary as detailed below:
1) Cost of interstate travel by second-class railway fare / KTC/ GTDC buses will be borne by the Corporation under the scheme.
2) D.A. @ Rs.275/- per beneficiary per day will be provided in case of visits to A-1 class cities and for other classes of cities the D.A. will Rs.200/- per day..
3) The total cost per tour will not exceed Rs.1.00 lakh. However, in special cases, this amount can be increased depending on the duration of the tour, distance covered, etc. but in any case, the total amount shall not exceed Rs.1.5 lakh per tour.
title: Scheme for Handicrafts artisans for participating in interstate crafts mela, exhibitions and interstate tour for visiting handicrafts establishments in other states within the country
funding_pattern: The pattern of assistance for release of grant in aid is approved by the Finance Department.

description: The Goa, Daman and Diu Official Language Act was passed in 1987, and Konkani being the Official Language all the official work is required to been done in Konkani, as is the practice in other States. The Government has therefore prepared a syllabus based on the recommendations of a Committee, co-ordinated by Dr. Tanaji Halarnkar on the lines of Hindi Teaching Scheme of Government of India. The Government intends to train all the Government employees in Official Languages and the Syllabus prepared by the Committee will be utilized to equip the employees with minimum use of Konkani language.
title: Rajbhas Prashikshan Evzonn 2008
funding_pattern: Not specified

description: The scheme has been formulated to provide financial assistance to the magazines/periodicals dedicated for dissemination and promotion of local languages through their periodical issues.\nMany periodicals/magazines in Konkani, Marathi languages are being published in Goa regularly, thereby promoting these local languages. The publishers of such periodicals/ /magazines have to face financial hardships, despite of which, their publications are continued as social obligation.
title: Akshar Mitra Yojana
funding_pattern: maximum upto Rs. 3.00 lakhs annually for a period of two consecutive years

description: The scheme has been designed to provide financial support to organize language skill programs which will support the Official Language Konkani for day to day use of Konkani language in the field of Administration, Education, Culture etc. The scheme will be implemented by the Directorate of Official Language and no grant will be released to any Institution/Department. However, expenditure towards the program will be borne by the Directorate of Official Language.

procedures.step_description: The applicant institution/group/department shall submit the request letter specifying the name of the program and the details of the expenses to be incurred for the program and make the request to conduct such program which will benefit the public at large for the promotion of Official Language.
On receipt of the application, it shall be scrutinized at a level of Assistant Director and shall be submitted to the Head of Office/Head of Department for sanction and approval.

title: Rajbhasha Jagruti Yojana
funding_pattern: The Directorate of Official Language will bear the expenses.

description: To encourage writers in the State to develop their talent and to give boost to Official Language. i. e. Konkani and Marathi.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Citizen of India of Goan Origin

procedures.step_description: The Directorate of Official Language shall release an advertisement/Press note on local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications from Goan writers for availing benefits under the Scheme.
Entries must be sent in the “Application Form” given at Annexure, appended to the scheme alongwith three copies of the manuscript, for each entry.
A writer may send more than one entry for consideration, provided that their subject matter is different.
The entries must reach the Directorate of Official Language by post or delivered in person.
Address for sending the entry– The Director, Directorate of Official Language, 1st Lift, 5th Floor, Junta House, Panaji, Goa - 403 001.
Entries received after the prescribed date will not be considered.

The application shall be accompanied with: Passport size photograph of the writer, Age proof, Residence proof, Declaration stating that the manuscript has not been awarded under any other Scheme, Educational qualifications, which includes degree, awards, research and any other achievements in the field.
An Evaluation Committee constituted by the Government will consider the entries.
Close relative of participating writers will not be considered for inclusion in the Evaluation Committee.

title: Scheme for publications in Official Language 2008
funding_pattern: Up to Rs. 1.00 lakh as honorarium will be distributed on the date to be fixed by the Directorate of Official Language.

criteria.description: The manuscripts should be on the subjects - Science & Technology, Sociology including Goan Ethos, Philosophy and Social Awareness, Human Development, Finance, History, Agriculture/Rural Development, Media/Mass Communication/Information Technology, Tourism, Administration etc.
Only unpublished manuscripts are acceptable.
The manuscript should be an analytical review of the subject it deals with. Manuscripts written in the form of novel, story, play etc. or text books written for schools, will not be considered.
The manuscript should contain minimum 250 typed pages (A4 size).
Manuscripts which have already received honorarium/award under any other Scheme, will not be considered under this Scheme.

department_name: Department of Official Language and Public Grievancies

description: This scheme intends to assist various organizations/institutions with a view to promote and develop Official Language i.e. Konkani in devnagri script and also Marathi, Hindi and Sanskrit languages prevalent in Goa. This assistance will help to create awareness among the people on various aspects of Official Language and other supporting languages.
funding_pattern: 80% on the admissible expenditure for financial grants upto a maximum limit of Rs. 3 lakhs based on the nature of the events. With Government approval autonomus bodies set up and controlled by Government may be permitted grants upto 10 lakh.
title: Bhasha Vikas Yojana

description: To incentivize units for making their enterprises financially viable.

procedures.step_description: The claim for the year or part thereof shall be submitted after closure of financial year as per the timeline mentioned in the Umbrella Scheme, in specified proforma along with following documents:A self-attested copy of registration under Umbrella Scheme;A self-declaration in the format provided;The certificate issued by the nationalized banks/ specified financial institutions in respect of total interest paid by the units;The Financial Statements certified by a Chartered Accountant, of the financial year;CA certificate certifying the amount of interest paid (with a break up of interest paid on Working capital loan and Term Loan) and the annual turnover of the claim year. The certificate should also indicate the extent to which the loan is defaulted (in case of default) and whether the loan is rescheduled. In case the loan is rescheduled, the interest on rescheduled component and original component should be clearly indicated.A copy of payroll of the unit highlighting the number of total employees, and the number of Goan employees.Certificate from Chartered Accountant stating that no claim from the Department of Information Technology, Government of Goa, has been made for any incentives.For applications under Hinterland Eco tourism, the certificate of registration/or approval issued by the Department of Tourism/ CRZ Authority / IPB / Eco Sensitive Zone Authority shall be submitted.A CA certificate certifying that no other claim for similar benefit has been made under any other scheme/program of Government of Goa.

title: INTEREST SUBSIDY SCHEME, 2017
funding_pattern: The subsidy payable as calculated shall not exceed the ceiling of Rs. 25.00 lakh (27.50 lakh for all women and SC/ST applicants) per annum calculated on pro-rata basis for part of the year as claimed.

criteria.description: Micro, Small and Medium manufacturing industries listed under White category, Green category and Orange category, which have commenced production after 01/10/2017 are eligible.

The projects of Hinterland Eco tourism in lesser developed talukas registered with/ recognized by the Department of Tourism/ Goa IPB/ Town & Country Planning/PDA/Eco Sensitive Zone Authority will also be eligible to avail benefits under this scheme subject to fulfillment of all the other eligibility criteria.

Enterprises engaging a minimum of 60% of Goan manpower on regular employment are eligible for benefits under this scheme. (for the purpose of this condition, employees who are employed continuously during the claim year and are on the payroll of the unit for that year shall be considered.)

This Scheme is applicable to the enterprises which have availed loan as term loan and/or working capital loan for conducting business of the unit claiming the benefit, from any nationalized bank, scheduled private bank, Co- operative Bank, Economic Development Corporation Limited (EDC Ltd.) or any Non-Banking Financial Institutions recognized by the Reserve Bank of India and is restricted to interest paid to these organizations only.
The enterprises which are taking or have taken any benefit under any policy of the Department of Information Technology, Government of Goa, shall not be eligible for benefits under this scheme.
This scheme shall not be applicable to cases which have claimed similar benefit under any other scheme/program of Government of Goa.

description: The scheme supports industrial units in providing demand-driven short-term training courses through recognized institutions to address the gap between employer expectations and available skill sets in Goa.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Micro, Small, Medium and Large manufacturing enterprises
Goan youth between the age of 18 to 42 years

procedures.step_description: Employer submits a training proposal to the STP.
STP decides course fees, which are paid by the employer.

Application submitted to the Directorate of Industries Trade & Commerce with required documents (self-declaration, Umbrella Scheme registration, proposal copy, STP approval, course completion certificate, attendance, fee receipt, CA certificate).

title: INCENTIVES TO INDUSTRIES FOR TRAINING PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYEES SCHEME, 2017
funding_pattern: Reimbursement of 60% of training costs, up to Rs.60,000 per employee and Rs. 7,20,000 per unit per year. Subject to budgetary allocation.

criteria.description: Registered under the Goa State Incentives To Encourage Investments Scheme, 2017 (Umbrella Scheme)
Courses conducted by approved Skill Training Providers (STPs)
Trainees must be Goan as defined in the scheme
No similar benefit claimed under any other Government of Goa scheme/program

description: To encourage consumption through local purchases and to encourage economies of ancillary units, local MSMEs, and traders, including those in horticulture and food processing.

procedures.step_description: After the financial year's end, apply to the Directorate of Industries, Trade, and Commerce (DITC) with the necessary documents.
Submit a self-attested copy of registration under the Umbrella Scheme.
Provide an affidavit/self-declaration in the specified format.
Include self-certified copies of purchase bills from local sources.
Attach a statement of local purchases with vouchers showing GST payment details (state component), if applicable.
Submit the final accounts for the claim year.
Provide a chartered accountant (CA) certificate confirming payment for purchases, local sourcing within Goa, and use as raw material for manufacturing.
Include a CA certificate stating no other similar benefit claims under any Goa government scheme/program.

title: INCENTIVES TO ENCOURAGE PURCHASES FROM LOCAL SUPPLIERS SCHEME, 2017
funding_pattern: 2% of the cost of local purchases consumed by the unit, up to a maximum of Rs. 5.00 lakh per year. Value excluding GST is considered.

description: Goa’s beautiful and varied environment needs to be preserved. While industrial activity is important for economic growth and job creation, the Government of Goa is clear that this will not be at the cost of environment. Along with a specific thrust on encouraging environmentally conscious industry segments, the Government is keen to incentivize investments by existing and new units in environmentally friendly initiatives.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Manufacturing units under micro, small, medium and large category

procedures.step_description: A Certificate from the Chartered Accountant certifying the purchase value of the equipment along with invoice or any other supporting documents and a Certificate to the effect showing quantum of all subsidies including soft loans availed if any and the interest paid thereon, with regard to each of these equipment. Further, the percentage of subsidy availed shall also be mentioned.

funding_pattern: Reimbursement
title: INCENTIVES TO GREEN INVESTMENT SCHEME, 2017

description: In order to make the existing industry in Goa competitive, Government of Goa encourages units based in Goa to obtain certification from reputed certifying agencies and registration of intellectual property rights.\nThe scheme provides reimbursement of expenses incurred by industrial and business units to obtain certification and IPR.

procedures.step_description: The eligible unit shall apply to Directorate of Industries, Trade & Commerce along with the required documents.

funding_pattern: Reimbursement of charges to the extent of 100% of actual expenditure per certification, subject to a combined ceiling of Rs.8.00 lakh for the entire period of the Scheme.\nReimbursement of 50% of the professional fees for registration and fees paid to the registry for registration of Intellectual Property Rights subject to maximum ceiling of Rs.15.00 lakh (excluding certification reimbursement) for the entire period of the Scheme.
title: FINANCIAL INCENTIVES FOR CERTIFICATION AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS REIMBURSEMENT SCHEME, 2017

description: The scheme envisages grant of loans to younger population of Goa to assist them in their pursuit of higher and technical education. It provides for exemption from the payment of interest charges, as long as the loanees adhere to repayment schedule strictly. For this purpose, maximum five years of study period /course duration is covered in India and maximum of two years course duration is covered for abroad courses.  The scheme enumerates the eligibility criteria to be followed for the selection of candidates, criteria for economic/financial constraints and details of approved courses that can be undertaken.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Any person below the age of 30 years, who has been a resident of Goa for a period of 15 years

funding_pattern: The Government will establish a \"Higher Education Promotion Fund\" (HEPF, from which all loans that are sanctioned under this scheme will be disbursed and to which all recoveries made under the scheme shall be credited.
title: Interest Free Education Loan Scheme

criteria.description: Has passed the qualifying examination i.e. Std Xth or XIIth for professional / non-professional courses at diploma / degree level from any of the recognized institutions situated from Goa. Graduation from recognized institutions in Goa for postgraduate courses. Graduation from institutions outside Goa in case of those educational courses which are not available in Goa. Post Graduation for PhD courses.

Studies in India: Has obtained 55% or more marks in the qualifying examination. (For candidates belonging to SC/ST/OBC categories, the qualifying marks will be relaxable by 10%). Studies abroad (outside India): Has obtained 60% or more marks in the qualifying examination. (For candidates belonging to SC/ST/OBC categories, the qualifying marks will be relaxable by 10%).
Meets the prescribed eligibility conditions relating to economic/financial constraints.
Undertakes any of the courses approved under this Scheme.

description:
The Goa IT Policy 2023 aims to transform Goa into a leading hub for high-end technology companies and innovation. The policy focuses on attracting investments, fostering skill development, and creating a supportive ecosystem. Key features include:

* **Infrastructure Development:** Establishing a state-of-the-art Technology Park with plug-and-play facilities, utilizing green technologies and solar power.
* **Fiscal Incentives:** Rebates on land, lease rentals, capital investment, power, internet, and salaries. Subsidies for patents, quality certifications, and marketing.
* **Governance:** 24/7 operations, exemptions from labor law inspections, and an Empowered Committee for streamlined decision-making.
* **Human Resource Development:** Certification programs, industry collaboration, and training programs for students.

The policy also encourages participation from the Goan diaspora and offers special incentives for multinational companies and smaller business units. It operates for five years with provisions for periodic review and updates.

procedures.step_description: Refer to policy document for detailed information about specific scheme guidelines and procedures for availing benefits.

valid_upto: Five years from the date of notification in the official gazette.
funding_pattern: Grants, subsidies, and reimbursements are provided based on specific criteria and guidelines.
title: Goa IT Policy 2023
introduced_on: Not specified in the document. Date of notification in the official gazette marks the start.

description:
The Goa IT Policy 2023 aims to establish Goa as a prominent hub for the Information Technology industry.  Key features of the policy include:

* **Infrastructure Development:**  Construction of a state-of-the-art Technology Park with an IT Village, offering plug-and-play facilities and green technologies.
* **Fiscal Incentives:**  Rebates on land, built-up area, lease rentals, capital investment, stamp duty, power bills, internet bandwidth, salaries, patent filing, and quality certification.
* **Governance:**  24/7 operations, exemption from routine labor inspections, an Empowered Committee for approvals, and a Goa IT Advisory Council.
* **Human Capital Development:**  Reimbursement for certification programs, industry collaboration with educational institutions, and training programs for students.

The policy also encourages the participation of Goan diaspora and offers special incentives for smaller business units and multinational technology companies.
funding_pattern: Incentives and subsidies are provided through government funding.
title: Goa IT Policy 2023

description: The Government of Goa is pleased to frame the “Capital Subsidy Scheme, 2017” to provide financial assistance to the enterprises in the state of Goa. This scheme shall be governed by the Goa State Incentives to Encourage Investments Scheme 2017.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: All micro and small scale manufacturing units falling under white, green and orange category
All manufacturing units which have commenced commercial production after 1.10.2017
All units which carry out substantial expansion after 1.10.2017 as defined in the umbrella scheme

procedures.step_description: The benefits sanctioned under this scheme shall be disbursed in two equal installments.
The units shall be required to make separate applications for release of each eligible installment.
The eligible units shall apply for capital subsidy within one year of the date of commencement of commercial production.
The first installment of subsidy i.e. 50% of the total sanctioned amount shall be released to the applicant after the recommendation of the Task Force Committee.

After completion of two years from the date of commencement of commercial production, the eligible functioning units shall apply in the specified proforma to the Directorate of Industries, Trade & Commerce along with documents as specified.

funding_pattern: A capital subsidy of 30% of the cost of capital subject to a ceiling of Rs 10 lakh for micro units, provided the subsidy on building/office is restricted to Rs 5 lakh; shall be granted under this scheme. A capital subsidy of 30% of the cost of capital subject to a ceiling of Rs 20 lakh for small units provided the subsidy on building/office is restricted to Rs 10 lakh shall be granted under this scheme. For the purpose of this scheme, the cost of capital shall include the cost of: i. All plant and machinery installed in the unit; ii. Information and Communication Technology (ICT) equipment required to operate the machinery; iii. Office and Factory premises. However, the cost of land, pre-operative expenses,office equipment, ICT equipment for office use, all types of furniture and ERP software shall not be included while calculating the cost of capital. For units which have commenced commercial production after 1.10.2017, the eligible purchases made before 1.10.2017 will be considered for calculation of cost of capital subject to CA certification that such purchases have been utilized for the project under claim. The benefits under this scheme are subjected to budgetary allocation. No Promisory Estoppel shall be applicable if benefits are discontinued in case allocation is exceeded.
title: CAPITAL SUBSIDY SCHEME, 2017
documents: A self-attested copy of registration under Umbrella Scheme
A self-declaration in the format provided
Relevant Invoices and Receipts to support the claim amount
A certificate from a Chartered Accountant certifying the investment as per requirement of the scheme.
A certificate from a chartered accountant certifying that the unit has not availed any incentive from Department of Information Technology, Govt. of Goa.
A CA certificate certifying that no other claim for similar benefit has been made under any other scheme/program of Government of Goa.
Audited balance sheets of above referred two years
Income tax returns of above referred two years
GST Returns of two years/ ROC returns (if applicable)

criteria.description: The units which have availed of CMRY scheme or any scheme of Government of India/Government of Goa wherein capital subsidy is granted shall not be eligible for benefits under this scheme.

The units which are taking or have taken any benefit under the Information Technology Investment Policy of the Department of Information Technology, Government of Goa shall not be eligible for benefits under this scheme.
This scheme shall not be applicable to cases which have claimed similar benefit under any other scheme/program of Government of Goa.

description: To create an environment conducive for attracting investment in the State of Goa and to incentivize existing units to be competitive while giving boost to local employment.
funding_pattern: The total subsidy shall not exceed Rs.25.00 lakh per annum, on pro rata basis depending on the date of production for Micro, Small, Medium enterprises and eco-tourism projects.\nThe total subsidy shall not exceed Rs.50.00 lakh per annum pro rata basis depending on the date of production for Large enterprises.
title: EMPLOYMENT SUBSIDY SCHEME, 2017

description: No socio economic programme and development of the State is possible without providing proper education and suitable employment opportunities to the adolescent. They need to be made aware of issues like, health care and hygiene, sexual responsibility, safe mother-hood, family size, HIV/AIDS prevention, drug and alcohol abuse, control of aggression etc.
title: Adolescence Education Programme
funding_pattern: Sponsored by NACO

description: A centrally sponsored Scheme of the Union Government of India under the Ministry of Human Resources Department, department of Elementary Education and Literacy. The Institute has come into existence as a DIET in June 1990. The Diploma in Education (D.ED) programme is a major activity of this Institution, so as to educate the Teachers working in the field of Elementary level. As a Micro Level unit, a DIET is sensitive to the problem and need of Elementary Education within its Jurisdiction, by providing In-Service and Pre-Service Training; Preparation of District Plan for Universalisation; Activities to improve and support community involvement and Adult Education and Strengthening of their own capacity.
funding_pattern: Centrally Sponsored
title: District Institute of Educational Training
department_name: Ministry of Human Resources Department, department of Elementary Education and Literacy

description:
The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) is a comprehensive mission launched by the Central Government of India with the objective of "Housing for All by 2022". This initiative aims to address the housing needs of urban poor, including slum dwellers, through four key programme verticals:

1. **"In-situ" Slum Redevelopment:**  Redeveloping existing slums where they are, using land as a resource and involving private developers. This approach seeks to unlock the potential of land under slums and bring slum dwellers into formal urban settlements.
2. **Credit-Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS):** Providing interest subsidies on home loans for eligible urban poor (EWS/LIG) to acquire or construct houses.
3. **Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP):** Partnering with public and private sectors to build affordable housing projects, with a focus on providing houses for the EWS category at affordable rates.
4. **Subsidy for Beneficiary-led Individual House Construction/Enhancement:** Offering financial assistance to eligible EWS families to construct new houses or enhance existing ones.

Key features of the PMAY include providing houses with a carpet area of up to 30 square meters (with flexibility for states to adjust based on local needs), ensuring basic civic infrastructure, and promoting female ownership of houses. The Mission also emphasizes structural safety, encourages the formation of resident welfare associations, and prioritizes housing for vulnerable groups like manual scavengers, women, SC/ST/OBC, minorities, and persons with disabilities.
funding_pattern: Centrally Sponsored Scheme (except for the credit-linked subsidy component, which is a Central Sector Scheme)
title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana
department_name: Ministry of Housing & Urban Poverty Alleviation

description:
The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM) aims to reduce urban poverty and vulnerability by providing access to self-employment, skilled wage employment, and shelter for the urban homeless. Key features include:

*   **Focus on the urban poor:** Including the homeless and street vendors.
*   **Social mobilization and institution development:** Forming self-help groups (SHGs) and their federations.
*   **Capacity building and training:** For the urban poor and implementing agencies.
*   **Employment through skills training and placement:** Market-based skills training.
*   **Self-employment program:** Financial assistance for micro-enterprises.
*   **Support to urban street vendors:** Access to spaces, credit, and skills.
*   **Shelter for the urban homeless:** Permanent shelters with essential services.
*   **Funding pattern:** Shared between the Centre and States/UTs.
*   **Three-tier structure:** National, State, and City Mission Management Units.
funding_pattern: Shared between the Centre and the States/UTs based on their category (North Eastern States, Himalayan States, other States, UTs).
title: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM)
introduced_on: Not specified in document, but revised funding pattern effective from 1st April 2015
department_name: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

description: The Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban aims to eliminate open defecation and eradicate manual scavenging, implement modern and scientific municipal solid waste management, effect behavioral change regarding healthy sanitation practices, generate awareness about sanitation and its linkage with public health, and augment capacity for Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) to create an enabling environment for private sector participation.
funding_pattern: The estimated cost of SBM (Urban) is Rs. 62,009 Crore. Government of India share is Rs. 14,623 Crore. States/ULBs will contribute a minimum of 25% of the GoI funding (Rs. 4,874 Crore). Remaining funds will be from private sector, additional state/ULB resources, beneficiary share, user charges, land leveraging, innovative revenue streams, Swachh Bharat Kosh, Corporate Social Responsibility, market borrowing, and external assistance.
title: Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban

description: To encourage writers in the State to develop their talent and to give boost to Official Language. i. e. Konkani and Marathi.

procedures.step_description: The Directorate of Official Language shall release an advertisement/Press note on local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications from Goan writers for availing benefits under the Scheme.
Entries must be sent in the “Application Form” given at Annexure, appended to the scheme alongwith three copies of the manuscript, for each entry.
A writer may send more than one entry for consideration, provided that their subject matter is different.
The entries must reach the Directorate of Official Language by post or delivered in person.
Entries received after the prescribed date will not be considered.
An Evaluation Committee constituted by the Government will consider the entries.

funding_pattern: Upto Rs. 1.00 lakh
title: Scheme for publications in Official Language 2008

description: To encourage farmer to go in for poultry production & increase poultry meat and egg production in the state.  25% of cost of Plant and Machinery will be granted as subsidy subject to maximum of Rs.2.00 lakhs to any individual for setting up Poultry Units. The minimum unit size should be 2000 broilers (500 broilers per fortnight) or 5000 layers.

procedures.step_description: The beneficiary can start a Unit with his own finance or by availing loan from the Financial Institution. In case the beneficiary avails loan from Financial Institution subsidy will be released through the concerned Financial Institution.

The Project Report of the proposed Unit is to be submitted to the Director of Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services through the Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director alongwith the following documents.
After completion of the Unit, the following documents are required to be submitted by the applicant for release of subsidy.

funding_pattern: 25% of cost of Plant and Machinery subject to maximum of Rs.2.00 lakhs
title: Financial Assistance for establishment of Modern Poultry Farm and purchase of Poultry Farm equipments

criteria.description: Any individual having some experience in Poultry Keeping.

documents: Documents indicating ownership of land in Form I & XIV or copy of Lease Deed or N.O.C. from the Landlord in case of Tenants.
In case of lease the same should be for a minimum period of 10 years from the date of starting the Unit.
NOC from the Landlord to run the unit for a minimum period of 10 years
Purchase receipt of equipments, machinery and 1st batch of poultry birds.
Valuation certificate of shed and stores from approved valuer

description: Amendment to the scheme “Subsidy for custom service in Agriculture”.Clause 4: Pattern of assistance at (iii) (d) is replaced and shall be read as Rs. 14,000/- per Ha or 1.40 per sq. mtr. including cost of seedlings, raising of nursery & transportation. Other contents of the Notification remains the same. This amendment will be effective for transplanting of paddy w.e.f. Kharif 2016 onwards.
scheme_link: Reg. No. G-2/RNP/GOA/32/2015-2017 RNI No. GOAENG/2002/6410 Panaji, 21st July, 2016 (Asadha 30, 1938) SERIES I No. 16
funding_pattern: Subsidy
title: Subsidy for custom service in agriculture

description: The Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar) recognizes and honors young Goan artists (25-40 years old, with possible age relaxation) for their outstanding achievements and contributions to the field of Art & Culture in Goa.  The award includes a memento, certificate of appreciation, and a financial purse of Rs. 25,000.

procedures.step_description: The Department of Art & Culture releases a press advertisement inviting recommendations from eminent institutions and individuals.
The Department may also directly write to institutions and individuals for recommendations.
The committee may also suo-moto consider artists with outstanding achievements.
The Director of Art & Culture obtains acceptance from the recommended artist.
A felicitation program is organized to honor the artist with the award.

funding_pattern: Rs. 25,000 per awardee
introduced_on: Date of publication in Official Gazette
title: YUVA SRUJAN PURASKAR

criteria.description: An individual artist between the age of 25-40 years (with possible relaxation of up to 5 years) who has made an extraordinary contribution to Art & Culture in their respective field.
The artist should have contributed to their field in Goa for at least 5 years of their career as a practicing artist.
The award is not presented posthumously, except in cases where the artist's death occurs after being recommended.
An artist cannot receive the award a second time.
A maximum of 6 individuals in various art fields are considered for the award annually.

description: In order to promote cultural activities in the State of Goa and to and develop cultural talent,\nGovernment has designed this Scheme to provide financial support to voluntarily Cultural\nOrganizations.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Goan institution registered under Society’s Registration Act, 1860 or under Indian Trust Act

procedures.step_description: The eligible institution shall apply to the Director of Art &Culture in prescribed form along with following documents.

introduced_on: Date of publication in the Official Gazette
title: MAINTENANCE GRANTS SCHEME
funding_pattern: reimbursement of the expenditure incurred by the institution for the last financial year
documents: A copy of Constitution/Bye Laws/Rules and Regulations
Registration Certificate (Renewal certificate if it is renewed)
Report of activities list of committee members
Financial statements of last year duly certified by the C. A. & office bearers

description: The Kala Gaurav Puraskar scheme aims to recognize and felicitate artists above 60 years of age who have made outstanding contributions to art and culture in Goa. Eligible artists will receive a shawl, shrifal, a certificate of appreciation, and a financial purse of Rs. 25,000. Up to 30 artists will be awarded annually, subject to fund availability.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Individual artist who has completed 60 years of age and who has given substantial contribution in his/her respective field of art
Goan artist who has contributed in his/her respective field of art in Goa for minimum 10 years

procedures.step_description: Department of Art and Culture releases a press advertisement inviting recommendations from eminent institutions and individuals.
Department may also directly write to institutions and individuals for recommendations.
A Sub-Committee considers the received recommendations and may also suo-moto consider artists.
Sub-Committee submits its recommendations to the Director of Art & Culture.
Director submits recommendations for Government approval.
Directorate organizes a felicitation program for approved artists.

funding_pattern: Rs. 25,000 per individual. Up to 30 individuals annually.
title: Kala Gaurav Puraskar Scheme
introduced_on: Date of publication in the Official Gazette

criteria.description: Completed 60 years of age.
Substantial contribution in their respective field of art.
Minimum 10 years of contribution to their field of art in Goa (for Goan artists).
Not a recipient of the State Cultural Award.

description: The Government of Goa has designed this scheme, to grant financial assistance to eminent artists who are in indigent circumstances as token of respect to them in their contribution in the field of Art & Culture.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: eminent artists who are in indigent circumstances

procedures.step_description: Director of Art & Culture shall release an advertisement on local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications from eligible applicants for availing benefit under this scheme.
The interested artist could apply to the Director of Art & Culture in prescribed proforma along with latest passport size photograph and following documents

introduced_on: the date of its publication in the Official Gazette
title: Kala Samman Scheme,2016
funding_pattern: ₹ 2,500/- per month every year for eligible artist and ₹ 3,200/- per month every year for recipient of State Cultural Award

criteria.description: Artist should attain the age of 60 years at the time of applying for the scheme.
Artist must have given contribution in the field of Art & Culture or should have worked in the field of Art & Culture.
The income of the applicant artist should not exceed ₹ 48,000/- per annum. (However this clause shall not be applicable, where the applicant is recipient of' ‘State Cultural Award').

documents: Attested photocopy of Birth certificate or school leaving certificate
copy of Aadhar card or baptism certificate certifying his birth date
A resume of the applicant artist giving details of work done by the artist in the field of Art & Culture
References of two known persons or institutions working in respective field of Art & Culture

description: The main objective is to create opportunity by which people from different parts of the country will get to know about one another's culture and promote National Integration. Under this scheme every year cultural troupes are sent to other states and in turn troupes from other states are received in Goa.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Any Institution/Group willing to participate in the exchange programme

procedures.step_description: After finalizing visit schedule in the conference of Sangeet Natak Academy the programme of visit is informed to groups and their willingness is invited.

The Cultural institutions and organizations working in training the artists and promoting the local talent having standing eminence have to submit their willingness for participation in programme to the directorate in stipulated time.
A committee set up in the department shall hold selection trials and the best performing groups are selected in order of merit and the groups are deputed turn by turn.
In case of exigencies reputed troupes are contacted directly for deputation.

funding_pattern: Not specified
title: Inter State Exchange of Cultural Troupes

criteria.description: The items/programmes to be presented by the groups should be based on traditions and cultural heritage of the state.
The participants in the troupes should be as far as possible folk artists of the area and the number should not be more than fifteen in each case.
Each time groups i.e. male and female artists shall be considered for deputation.

description: The Gomant Vibhushan Award is a prestigious award presented by the Government of Goa every two years to honor Goan personalities who have made exceptional contributions in various fields at national and international levels. The award includes a memento, citation, and a financial purse of Rs. 5,00,000/-.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Goan origin personalities with distinguished and exceptional achievements/services in any field at national & international level

procedures.step_description: Recommendations are invited through advertisements in local newspapers from sources like Chief Minister/Governor of Goa State, Ministers, Members of the Legislative Assembly, Members of Parliament, Government Departments of Goa, private individuals, and bodies.
A Selection Committee under the Chairmanship of the Chief Minister of Goa reviews the recommendations and makes selections.
After obtaining acceptance from the selected individual, the Department of Art & Culture organizes a felicitation program to present the award.

title: Gomant Vibhushan Award
funding_pattern: One-time financial assistance of Rs. 5,00,000/-.

criteria.description: Distinguished and exceptional achievements/services in all fields of activities/disciplines such as art & culture, literature & education, sports, medicine, social work, civil services, public affairs, trade, science & engineering, industry, economics, philosophy, politics, or any other field at national & international level.
Persons of Goan origin, without distinction of race, occupation, position, age or sex.

description: The Goa State Village Panchayat/NGO’s Libraries Financial Assistance Scheme, 2014.
title: The Goa State Village Panchayat/NGO’s Libraries Financial Assistance Scheme, 2014
funding_pattern: 100% on expenditure incurred on admissible items, other than remuneration subject to maximum of Rs. 2,00,000/- (Rupees two lakhs only) for Class ‘A’ libraries, Rs. 1,50,000 (Rupees one lakh fifty thousand only) for Class ‘B’ libraries, Rs. 1,00,000 (Rupees one lakh only) for Class ‘C’ libraries, and Rs. 60,000 (Rupees Sixty thousand only) for Class ‘D’ libraries.  A token grant of Rs. 1,00,000/- (Rupees one lakh only) is available for new libraries.

description: The scheme has been designed with an objective to encourage Goan Scholars to undertake research in the field of social studies, history culture etc. Three fellowships shall be awarded one at junior, one at senior level & one at post-doctoral level each for research in the specified areas every year.

procedures.step_description: Department of Art & Culture releases a press advertisement inviting applications.
Selection committee evaluates the scholars.
Project report submission within 30 days after completion of the two-year fellowship.

title: D. D. Kosambi Research Fellowship Scheme
funding_pattern: Rs. 10,000 per month for junior category (up to 2 years), Rs. 20,000 per month for senior & post-doctoral category (up to 2 years)

criteria.description: Any individual who has completed his/her post-graduation and is upto 35 years of age
Any individual who has completed his/her post graduation and is above the age of 35
Any individual who has completed his/her Ph.D.

description: The Government of Goa has designed this scheme in order to give financial support to the institutions involved in long term projects in the field of Art & Culture.

procedures.step_description: The institution should apply in writing alongwith the following: A copy of Constitution/Bye Laws/Rules and Regulations. Registration Certificate. Audited statement of accounts of last 3 preceding years duly signed by the Chartered Accountant. Detail project report of that particular long term project for which financial support is asked under this scheme. Any other relevant documents.

funding_pattern: 80% of total expenditure involved subject to maximum ceiling of Rs. 5.00 lakhs per annum.
title: Scheme to provide Grant to the institutions for Long Term Project in the Field of Art and Culture, 2007

description: Scheme to provide financial assistance to high schools in Goa for purchasing Art Material.

procedures.step_description: Every year, the Directorate of Art and Culture shall suo-moto select not more than 50 high schools from Government, Non-Government aided and Non-Government un-aided high schools randomly, under the Scheme.
Application forms for the same shall be released to these high schools from the department.

The schools interested in availing benefit of the Scheme shall submit the forms within a stipulated time period with the following enclosures: Valid Government recognition certificate for the high school; Name and qualifications of the drawing teacher.

title: Scheme to provide Financial Assistance to High Schools for purchasing Art Material.
funding_pattern: Rs. 5,000/- per high school per year.

criteria.description: Any high school in Goa (Government/Non-Government aided/Non-Government un-aided) shall be eligible under this Scheme provided it is recognized by the Government.
The high school should have atleast one well qualified Art teacher employed on permanent basis.
Drawing/painting should be one of the subjects and there should be substantial students having opted for the subject.
